pgXCWBn6dmNXUONqy82YlA.text: First time here with family. The food was great I ordered a burger. Everyone else had breakfast food. The grits were made with cream, they were so good. Also service was great! The waitress was so friendly and helpful. If I'm in the area again I will definitely go back.

ULCDQFz1DalPdwH5qlLpqQ.text: We were a party of 4 in town for a concert. We selected this spot as it had a minimal wait time. We all ordered 2 burgers (the California and the Carolina), fish filet sandwich, and a firecracker chicken sandwich. The burgers were decent . Certainly not the best nor so good we would think of this spot as the go-to place for a burger. The fish filet was thin, as well as, the chicken on the other sandwich. My friend actually sent her chicken back as it was all bread. One of the plates we paid extra for onion rings which the kitchen didn't get right, but the waitress quickly remedied that. We had ordered an appetizer, but it never came and the waitress didn't even notice. I had to suggest to her that it be taken off the bill as it didn't arrive. We felt neglected by our waitress. My impression was that management had given her too many tables as she always seemed busy.

eZJGWNLwJR3mpVvL_QVyYA.text: Great food and service. Only issue it is located at EpiCentre. Went for lunch. Not many people. EpiCentre is dirty and the folks there were less than desirable.

C95kyppJqQZZWZ9qgJwF3g.text: Great service.  They hustle and are super professional!  Great food!!! Wish we had one closer to home.

IGKPPQUxOrjx4-ps9yZEaw.text: The only reason I'm giving 1 star is the food was actually really good. The service, however, was absolutely awful. We were there mid-day on a Saturday. It was moderately busy & they seemed to have plenty of staff - who I watched congregating at the kitchen service window most of the time. It took nearly 10 minutes to be acknowledged by a server - who was nice on the rare occasion we saw her. We got our food & never saw her again (because she was chatting at the kitchen window) until we had to ask for our check.   The most appalling was the person at the dessert counter answered the phone & she mentioned to who appeared to be the  manager that they person on the phone wanted to speak to a manager. The woman waved her off & said I'm not dealing with anyone right now. We were sitting 5 feet from her so it was clear what she said despite the music playing. Sad, really because the food was good & given the location in Epicenter is a nice location - but it will be scratched off our list for sure.

tJA685t5JdYsZYlaSeXmWg.text: Redeye is a good quick stop for a delicious, greasy-spoon meal. My husband had a good sausage, egg, and cheese biscuit. He really enjoyed it. My plain turkey burger with provolone was good, but a bit overly greasy. It still tasted good, so I didn't grade down much. Our server was nice but not friendly. We would go back to try the biscuits & gravy!

FgAJCu0ewrloolBUqlGGrw.text: The Redeye Diner food quality and portions size versus cost is unbelievable. I enjoyed the 1/2 fried chicken meal which included a drumstick, wing, thigh, and breast (hence the 1/2 chicken labeling) which also included two nicely sized portions sides. My meal was 12.99 excluding drinks. The dine is a throwback to a 50's diner with hot rods, rock n roll records, and other 50's memorabilia.  This restaurant is a great stop for those looking for great food at value prices.

And it's not like it's packed, we are one of the few customers here on this day. This is rude and annoying. I hope you don't get treated like we are at this restaurant by liberal girls in red shirts. orcoEbL3kJK40YxPBZ4Dtg.text: This is some of the best comfort food in Charlotte. The staff are really friendly and the atmosphere is sort of "sports bar-meets- 1950s soda shop."  They serve a great breakfast. The French Toast is massive thick-cut challah bread and some of the best we've found in Charlotte. The pancakes taste like they're made with cake batter! Soooo good. The grits are the best in town. Ridiculously creamy!! Leaving fat & happy!

s0mT0oszqHjIwIA74xO-LA.text: This place has pretty much any type of breakfast food that you want. Not a fan of breakfast foods so went with a simple hash brown with onions and a biscuit.  Both were good and our service was on point. Cool diner atmosphere.

O7A-xpk67ohy_TGY1yxaIQ.text: The Redeye Diner has some amazing grits! Make sure to go here if you are in the Charlotte area.

SNc5ml02ZksEbX3Z3vOn2A.text: Food was great, but it took a good 6 minutes for our server to even acknowledge the 3 of us and an additional 5 minutes to get our drinks. It was a 6 o'clock on a Saturday and there was not a wait line. Our friend had ordered a BLT sandwich and asked to sub the French fries for hash browns. Once the food came out, we had started eating then the waitress realized our friend had not gotten the hash browns she had ordered. (7 minutes later) She simply apologized and went to the back, to come back with a Togo box asking our friend to scoop the fries in the box with her hands. Honestly it would not have been a big deal to us, but after waiting for so long for her to fix her mistake and making the absolute unordinary decision about it, we will actually re think about ever going back.

peybTXFoyt6UVLjR7kFBuQ.text: Decided to try Redeye, since I had been to Midnight Diner twice and wanted to see how they compared. The similarities were obvious--as were the differences. I will say upfront that Midnight is the winner of the coin toss, however I can't fail to mention what the Redeye staff did to meet my special request about my biscuit (read on). Oh, and after walking in it took me about 2 minutes after I was seated to go to Google to find out if the two were related through ownership. The answer: Yes, they are.  First, the decor: this is a different place. It is a relatively new in-city space: larger, more modern and without some of the "diner" feel of Midnight. That's OK: it couldn't be the same given it's location and new construction. However, if you want more of the True diner experience, then Midnight wins in that regard.  Now, the food: I did a bit more reaching for the unusual at Midnight, and got the Bubba (more about that on the review I posted with pictures). I was more restrained here, if you can call this restrained: a veggie omelette (hold the cheese), the livermush (my new favorite Southern version of scrapple), hash browns (a large serving, however very much (literally) within the lines of a rectangle, not the kind you get at Waffle House which is free form on the griddle), and a homemade biscuit. (By the way, we like to taste foods, not consume large quantities so we order what we want, eat a bit of the heavier stuff, and take the to-go box. It seems to work--at least most of the time).  Ah, the biscuit: I didn't want butter. OK... at most places, they take the biscuit, put some butter on it and hit the grill for a short time to warm it up. At Redeye, they apparently are home made from scratch, then have butter put on them at the time of cooking, so getting a biscuit without butter is a challenge. Their response? They put an entire pan of biscuits in the oven for me--without the butter--to serve me my delicious, crumbly home made biscuit. And, to boot, one of the managers came out to let me know they were working on my request. I was floored--and maybe a bit embarrassed to have them go through all of that trouble. Duly noted!!!  Now, the service: Cameron was great. However, this was the morning of the Komen race, so it probably is an unfair comparison: it seemed like the place was a bit overwhelmed. I suspect today is not a fair comparison, however coffee was late at several tables who shared their experience with each other. Like I said, they were busy, busy, busy--and this is probably not a typical Saturday morning.  All in all: good food, great menu, reasonable prices and variety to fit almost anyone's palate. Recommended, and I'd go again without hesitation.

U324YBnZLkcffEQ8qirgew.text: Hanging in Charlotte for a girls weekend.   Was looking for a place to grab from grub and a mimosa this morning.   We had fresh fruit, bacon and eggs and chicken and waffles.  Everything was delicious. Served HOT and pleasant staff.

83Sp-BQ1YO5yfy0FntRnCw.text: Came into the restaurant after the Heart Walk because we were already in Uptown and super hungry from the walk. We ordered quickly and soon saw our food coming but they gave it to the table behind us. We noticed this and the service staff didn't. We waited and waited and no one came to say Sorry there was a mistake and it will take a little longer for your food. Instead they tried to cover the mistake like the food just took a little longer. I watched the manager get informed about the situation and I think it's really poor customer service that she didn't come apologize to our table. Needless to say we were charged for both and never offer an apology for it taking so long. The food is subpar, basic diner food.

jJQvdGtDGC4f8PJFUS0fNw.text: Definitely had an interesting experience while dining at Redeye Diner for Brunch on a Monday morning. I will note that it was definitely strange to be there on a Monday around 10am - we had seen a concert in town the night before.  The menu is huge and had lots of selection, all reasonably priced and better yet (one of my FAVORITE things on a menu) they marked Redeye Diner recommendations! So I don't have to ask the waiter! I ended up with the Biscuits and Gravy special which was two huge biscuits covered with scrambled eggs, cheddar cheese, and so much sausage gravy!! I cannot explain how delicious it was, I don't normally go for a breakfast this large but it was definitely worth it.   The staff and space was interesting, decked out in 50s decor and definitely kept up with the diner theme. I definetly wouldn't go back for the service, staff, or enviornemnt but I would go back for the food!

iWmWVEMSs1aiFxeqeZL7UA.text: Really bad service!! The food could have tasted better had it been served as soon as it was prepared. I got cold food instead!   I reached the restaurant at about 2:45pm on a Sunday. The restaurant did not seem too busy at the time, and there was one person ahead of me waiting to be seated. There are open tables and seating available at the bar, but the waiter came to me only after 5 minutes, which is still fine. I sat at a small table and waited for 10 more minutes for somebody to take my order. Finally, a server came by to clean the adjacent table, and asked if I've been assisted already. I said no, so he took my order. He was short with me, but I didn't bother that either. After more than 20 minutes of waiting (all I ordered was two eggs, two buttermilk pancakes and grits), I noticed that other guests who had come after I did, and placed their orders later, got their food. I asked a waitress if she could check on my food as it had been a while. She shrugged and asked, "Well, who's your server?" I described to her, and in the meantime my server brought my food. I was happy finally I got my food, but the waiter again was short perhaps because I asked for my food, and asked, "Want me to get your check if you are in a hurry?" I was surprised, and said sure. As the waiter left, the elderly man sitting opposite me on a different table, frowned and shook his head. I enjoyed my cold food because I was hungry, but I wouldn't go back. The waiter came by later to pick-up my card and said, "Sorry for the delay in bringing your food, man. There is shift change happening now."

lEk7DclXnTNPO7ZO1uiAJA.text: This place is great they have great food! And after a night out we went here. My buddy left his wallet and "bubba" the head of security ran after us on our way out to make sure he got it back. Very good service along with excellent customer satisfaction.

tJ-4zGYgIN1yhLq2DvWXTw.text: My coworkers and I came in for lunch on Friday. To start off there were 10 of us, which we knew would be a hard task to seat together and even if we did sit together it would be very hard to eat and leave within the hour break. When we talked to the host about splitting up she took on the challenge of making a section fit so we could all stay together within a blink of an eye! Props to the host for thinking on her feet!  However, I would like to shout out our waitress, Cat, for absolutely amazing when it came to time and efficiency. Clearly lunch time is busy and I know it doesn't make it much easier when you have two 10 tops plus other tables you have to take care of. But Cat was very fast from beginning to end. Our table did not half to wait on her at all. On top of her being fast all of our food came out perfect. No hiccups, no forgotten sauces, no empty cups needing refills,  everything was on point. When it came to cashing out I noticed that she had another 10 top sending all their food back and just being all around rude to her. I saw the manager come talk to the table and it was obvious that our waitress had her hands full with the complaining table. Like I said before, Cat was a boss when it came to her waitressing skills. even though the other table was being complete jerks she still managed to handle them as well as cash out three other tables in a timely manner including our group.   So Cat if you get a chance to read this.. YOU ROCK! thanks for being awesome and nice! Sorry that other table did you like that.   Also for the manager that was doing the food ( girl with brown hair and glasses and pink shirt) you my friend need to be nicer. clearly if none of her other tables complained and everyone's food came out perfect except this one table... do you really honestly think it was the waitresses fault ? probably not. In addition, being mean or catching an attitude to your coworkers will not make them work better. Maybe you should try to understand and help fix the situation instead of adding more fuel to the fire.   Good food, great service!

kdqBNAuAEEw6nb7HONtpXg.text: Wow!  We unexpectedly had to stay overnight in Charlotte due to a flight cancellation. This place was recommended to us for breakfast. It was fantastic!  The service was extremely friendly. Our food was delicious. The biscuits and gravy, French toast, and grits were our favorites.

wNGnGG6B9iO1oYLZK5hNqQ.text: 12/22/18 - We came here to eat over the X-mas holiday of 2018.  We had a very good experience as far as the food goes.  We ended up arriving in town late and arrived around 1am and were immediately seated.  The Diner is in a multi-floor strip mall on the bottom level.  There were a lot of party goers ending their night which was noticeable but was not a problem.  We tried the chicken and waffles which came with 3 HUGE wings, we tried the quarter dark chicken with broccoli and mac and cheese, and the Philly Cheese steak. We all tasted portions of all and found them all to be very pleasing.  The quarter chicken, leg and thigh did not appear to be as fresh as the wings.  They were fine but were obviously not recently prepared as if they had been sitting waiting to be served for some time.  The Philly was great along with the wings and waffle.  We discussed coming back before we left but time did not permit.  We would recommend this Diner.

JUSjBWGM8y_Js6gNjWrX2A.text: Food was delicious, and fresh.  I ordered shrimp and grits, the creole sauce and sauteed veggies were a great addition to the creamy grits.  My kids ordered the French toast and wanted another order before we left, delicious! Our server, Mark was attentive and made sure we were satisfied.  Service was great!!! Definitely visiting this spot again while in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Grits....this was delicious!!!!  Definitely visiting again when we come back to Charlotte.

0qKOaDWkwm9iBiyBy6E2fw.text: Ambiance: classic American dinner with R&B and hip hop music (at least the day I went)  I got the fried chicken platter--chicken was tender and great! You must try the fire shrimp! It was amazing! I'm giving the restaurant three stars because the service was lacking.

umMtFoFJawXnU4f-y_hvGA.text: Service was great (a little delayed) but the food was mediocre. The chicken noodle soup had no noodles or chicken and when I asked the lady if it was more of a broth based soup she responded yes. Why even call it chicken noodle soup if there is one or two noodles. Luckily the lady brought us a new bowl with a little more in it. The chicken was hard to take off the bone and onions rings were cold.

vED0XhGBDjB9DQRLvRzOIA.text: Not a great experience.  Sat at the end of the counter where we watched every server dip cups into the ice bin with their hands while the ice scoop sat like an ornament in a bin on the side.  The manager even did the same dragging the keys on her wrist through the ice as well.  Got my BLT with exactly two pieces of bacon on it and a bunch of shredded lettuce.  The fries came out like they had been in the fryer for thirty seconds,  they were pale and cold in the middle.  I won't be coming back.

XAGq2yv1jD4sPOq0jl72gA.text: John Smith took care of us he was awesome great job taking care of us. The food was hot and great tasting.

8j-X9WuOp-gIiuELrIVW4Q.text: Hungry? Drunk? Drunk and hungry? Hungry with people who are picky? Hungry, drunk, with a group that is picky? Red eye Diner is the place to Beni matter the day, time, or reason. The grapevine says this place is owned by the owners of Midnight Diner, and I agree based on the grits. Anyway back to the diner! The diner is like a flash back in time to an old school soda shop! But the menu - AMAZING! From spaghetti, to burgers, to wings, to fried chicken they don't get anything wrong. While in town for CIAA weekend, my group and I are at Redeye two days in a row- and there were no complaints, which is hard for a group of girls who can be picky and are trying to keep the bloat down to look our best while enjoying the weekend. Needless to say, great food has a way of making you forget about bloating so fried chicken, waffles, omelettes, grits, Mac and cheese and teriyaki wings were ordered more than we may admit. And- for those looking for a sprinkle of health- i did have a side salad which was a great size and delicious! And the homemade ranch will change your life. Overall, for a great price and a large amount of bang for your buck - THIS IS THE PLACE! Oh and the staff is really attentive and ready to help in any way!

ts7rKPawf3Tpnof2KgXbfA.text: I will leave extra early before my next flight to stop here. Large portions for an affordable price and is actually good food.  The chicken wings are well seasoned and not a knock off baby drumstick or wing.  The shrimp and grits are even better after sitting-i had left overs and ate it once i reached my final destination. Buen provecho!

cAElormiGJ8cxBMqg4zR5w.text: I went with 5 friends for breakfast on a trip to Charlotte.  The ACC championship game was in town, so the wait was about 45 mins around 10am.   Overall, the food was good but not great.  I ordered a good corned beef hash.  The eggs were a bit oily, but the biscuit was solid.  The Hasbbrowns (with onions) were greasy, but somewhat flavorful.  The pancakes were thick and heavy, if that's your thing.  The disappointments were the syrup (gooey and gross) and the coffee (bad tasting).  I was torn between this and 3 stars, but the hash and the other food on the table was OK.  It's worth noting that a southerner in our group said the gravy was just mediocre.  I'll gift this 4 stars, but probably won't go back.

PiSqhT5pJR1J9AwN939b9A.text: This was a great experience. I love a good Diner and I am adding this to my list. The service was good. There weren't many people in the restaurant when we got there which was good. The chicken and waffles was very good. I had 2 wings and a waffle. Their coconut dipped French toast though....OMG....loved it. Tip: the hash browns are way overpriced for the itty bitty portion they give. I will not order those again. But overall this was a winner.

tUELBr59QTuSbGh3jhTzpw.text: Ordered To Go food. Not only did it take almost triple the time I was quoted, it was slow and all of the employees were playing around. They have a ton of fried or heavier foods just for that. It's at the epi center where all the late night spots are. Upon entering we were greeted and seated. We came because the person I was with raved about there shrimp and grits. The shrimp and grits were okay. I had the fried chicken wings and French toast (substitute to the waffle). I though it was good. The server was nice. You can keep the party going after tour late night here because they have alcoholic beverages.  The prices are reasonable. They give a check in offer for yelp, but I couldn't get the WiFi working right with my phone. Maybe you will have better luck. So if your looking for comfort food this is your spot.

ErO7rYJuQ_30CZOX15-okQ.text: The food was great ! John Smith was a wonderful waiter!  Very friendly and attentive to our table. The Philly cheesesteak was banging ! We went in last night and came back again today ! That's how good the food is!!!  The only Reason I'm not giving five Stars is for sanitary reasons. While being in the bathroom there was an employee that used the bathroom and left out without washing her hands .

zNImvH4ZM0xN5jIdrGJStw.text: I'm a routine patron at this diner and always love it when Patrick waits on me!! The food is generally good, but it's the service that is really special.  He always gets the order right and asks questions to make sure he knows just what we want. And he's great about getting refills and whatever we need! I'll be back -- and as much (if not more) for the service as the food!

f87v8EayXMhWk5uGu37L1g.text: I love a good diner experience, I don't know what it is but breakfast at a diner is just yummy . Now , Red eye did not disappoint . My style of eating constantly changes, extreme foodie here so sometimes it gets difficult to eat out . I want real butter on my food , none of that clarified stuff , but I didn't come to Red eye to feast on decadent bacon or buttery waffles .    First impression , BUSY ... I'm assuming due to the location. We were seated in a nice size booth and our waitress , she was phenomenal.  I can't remember how much I asked her to do , do you have heavy whipping cream , can we get extra straws, do you have splenda I don't like equal , etc. but she kept such a pleasant and joyful attitude .   On to the food , that's what we are mainly here for right? Mmmmmm , anything with eggs and avacodo is a win for me . The San Bernadarino  omelet with chicken was just the right size and no hidden pancake mix in the preparation to make it super fluffy , for my carb conscious eaters .  I got my order with a side of fruit, which was fresh and plentiful.  We got our lil one the kids breakfast special, pancake ( it was massive) with one egg and a meat of your choice .  $6 for that kids plate, I'll probably get that myself one day .   What made me give 4stars is there were no compliments about the food from anyone in my family , the service was fast and friendly , the atmosphere was a great mixture, and I saw more menu items I would love to try .

stm36K6bqcizGVDSTxHTJw.text: This place is okay I like that they have a wide array of options on their menu but the service in my opinion is just lacking I don't like the pay on your way out option and I feel like you should be able to give your method of payment to your waitress or your waiter but if they like it I love it.

INR3reGhkkO7VwrJm6JWUQ.text: From the moment I walked in, I knew I walked into a diner. Not just any diner but the diner I was searching for, with that classic juke box feel. I loved the records on the wall and the playlist was great. The mood was perfect and the food was tasty... enjoyably good. As a matter of a fact so good I went the next day for more. When you check out this spot, be sure to order the FRENCH TOAST.. oh my lord... the best French toast I have had, and I was visiting all the way from Orlando. Everyone greeted me with a smile and I knew I came to the right spot. MALCOLM was my server on both days and I truly enjoyed his energy. He made sure we were well taken care of and carried a great convo. He also directed me to a local souvenir shop where I can buy some things to take back home to Orlando. Thank you for the great service and amazing breakfast. I will be sure to visit again. Btw can you deliver French toast to Orlando ? lol

c5LAPuSsLjm0he-CdWtqwQ.text: This place is better than the one up the street. The grits are amazing along with the bacon. Had French toast and it was the smaller order and I'm stuffed. The staff was super friendly. We will back.

chhqZGoHXvsXx3_XfcPubw.text: The waffles are really good but the chicken is not good and the pancakes are good but taste super artificial

w9Io5AiCc6YF606p34E85Q.text: Me and two friends went here because we heard good things about it and wanted a semi-quick good meal. We ordered our meals and about a half hour later our food came out, in which we were each missing one thing off what we ordered. We told our waitress who apologized and swore she would fix the issue. Within another half hour we reminded the waitress about 3 times of our missing meals, we eventually paid for what we did get and never saw the rest of our order. And no, we did not tip her generously. I still hear people say the food is good but the service was so terrible that I will most likely never go again. I do not recommend.

Vjt5WXuxqLYiFK8OPvXwiQ.text: We had a great lunch here, the shrimp and grits surpassed my expectations. Being from out of town, we had a little trouble finding it, not realizing it was inside the Epicenter. Service was great, kudos to Shelby our server (see I did remember). Fun place with friendly staff. I'm knocking off one star because they try to game the system by insisting on a favorable review to get the check in discount. Jokes on them since there wasn't a signal connection there anyway.

ULp8Z95u5PEyysFgS86GdQ.text: Went to the restaurant and was seated. No one came to our table for 15 minutes to take our order.  Yet, there were 10 waiters sitting around talking. This was a Wednesday night and the restaurant was not in the least busy. As the guy who sat us down was sitting down another couple (15 mins later) he saw that we had still not been seen by a waiter so he requested one. The waiter went straight to the couple that had just walked in. So I left the restaurant. I've been all over this country and this is by far the worst customer service I have ever witnessed. Maybe they should hire Waffle House employees to get better service.

E8uAfG7b0O4bnFgLJ7SW6g.text: So I will never frequent this establishment and will definitely discourage friends and family from eating here.  Probably one of the most horrible customer experiences in my life at a restaurant and we didn't even stay for the food.  Went there on a Weekday around 6pm - only two other booths had customers.  Sat down, ordered 4 drinks.  Husband and I ordered jack and diets and our friends ordered two beers.  Waitress comes back and says they don't have jack and diets so I suggest makers but she says they don't have that either.  Then another lady comes and says oh yea, we have makers, so then they bring us our drinks.  Immediately upon sipping, I knew the liquor was not whiskey.  My husband figures out its rum because he hates rum so we ask to send it back and order something else.  Waitress disappears, comes back, says its policy that once the drink is poured, it's charged.  My husband and I both immediately are like, lemme speak to the manager.  Manager comes over and gives us the same fkn spiel.  We're livid at this point and demand they close out the tab so she's like.. Ok I'll make an exception and repair the drinks.  We go to the bar to see what liquors they have.  Turns out they don't have ANY whiskey so there's no way they could have served us what we ordered.  At that point we closed out cuz we had made enough of a scene that I was convinced if we stayed, they'd spit in our food (or worse).  Upon leaving one of our friends said they brought him the wrong beer.  I'm convinced that bc there used to serving drunk people out on the town in epicenter that they thought they could pull one over on us by serving us some gut-lining-remover rum and charge us for makers.  That or they're extraordinarily liquor dumb.  So in summary, 3/4 drink orders were wrong and apparently their customer policy is to charge the customer for the business's mistakes.   Shittiest. Customer service.  Ever.  Don't support this business.

j51kXqTb2QbR9Tr3Swfl9Q.text: What a disappointment! The diner was not busy and we sat for at least 15 minutes waiting for a server to come to our table before we got up and left. We were seated next to the server station, multiple servers stood around and talked to each other. We had been seated for about 10 minutes when the manager walked over to the sever station and asked who was going to pick up our table. They all walked away from her. Multiple servers continued to walk right passed us.

ryRBrrwrmL8ibJglyXTJWw.text: The manager Jordan Chaffin treats us like family.The servers especially Toni and Mike are fantastic. The food is always delicious. We recommend this diner to everyone who wants to well. The cheesecake is the best I ever tasted!!! Thanks Red Eye Diner for great service!!!!!!!

-Vc8AkAqJVH4IAFW887FYQ.text: I checked this spot out earlier this month and definitely said I would be back seeing the full bar wasn't opened yet. My second trip was well worth coming back for. This place is massive folks! The host could have been a little more friendlier but I went straight to the bar anyways. I am not sure where they found their bartender Mich but she is utterly breath taking and definitely made my second trip worth while. Very personable, food came out super quick, she was running circles around some of the other staff! Ive had friends say service is hit or miss here but I cant complain!   I will be back to try the infamous Shrimp and Grits for sure as well as the scenery behind their bar!

AF3RTdJEDZJ0_FzlV9iYfw.text: I went to the red eye diner for the first time last night and rita was my server and she was one of the best servers in my whole life! She suggested i get the firecracker shrimp and it was so good!! Thanks for the good experience rita! We will be back

A4OU9EhPGMaJZFuhlz_aSw.text: Visited this restaurant on a whim. Great decor, reminds you of a old school dinner. The waitress staff was really personable and made great recommendations. Tried the chicken and French toast. Chicken wings were JUMBO sized, had 3 but could have had only 2. French toast was flavorful as well. Pricing was reasonable. Downside they don't validate parking. They are also open 24 hours which is great for late night craves.

7GKgQx3W4cViBLNO01sGrQ.text: Hands down the worst service I have had in Charlotte!!! I gave it 2 chances and the service was god awful. The second time my friends and I (party of 4) walked out after waiting for over a hour AFTER we placed our order. I wanted to like it since the diner was at the Epicenter and the same menu as Midnight Diner, but unfortunately this is the biggest let down. I highly recommend not wasting your time.

5SeWlYSzgA-5L3xcvl7yQw.text: We had breakfast here during early afternoon. Good thing we had a lot of time;, eggs took at least 15-20 minutes to be served yet the diner wasn't busy.  Having said that, the food met expectations, our server was very friendly, and the diner was clean and bright. TVs visible everywhere and continuous oldies play in the background.  It's open 24/7.

bECGGbarxcObwZ9YA4xzPw.text: Hey Melanie H,  Are you serious?  You went on Thanksgiving day?  Why are you surprised?  If I went on Thanksgiving, i'd be more surprised if they DIDN'T spit in my food.  'I went to get my haircut and my hairdresser's water broke.  All that girl could talk about was how excited she was about her baby.   I was like, 'Girl.....  Finish my haircut.  Ain't nobody care 'bout your baby,' said heartless Yelp reviewer.

l4eriw2D_0kRCr76VyCj3A.text: Great food, great service. It was so hard to me to decide what to eat, but Ms, Patty guided me to an omelette egg supreme which sound so good to me; I gave it a try,  I love it so much that I will come back for a different suggestion.

GpfPQKGMroEsYlOFcPrBow.text: Easy E, or so he calls himself, is charming enough to be a server at any restaurant. Including high end steakhouses. At these type of places the food is always good. Why? Because how is it possible to mess up American classics? I ordered the fried chicken a waffles. The wife got the bacon cheeseburger. Both were satisfactory. Not the best we've ever had, but good. What stood out here is that we arrived after midnight and easy E was lively and welcoming. I wish I could put in a call and get this guy a the best gig available.

m5uxZZUYzNmGReq6QWgkzg.text: Breakfast today. 10:00 am not crowded. Asked to sit in front in empty space, told no we had to sit in back. Started badly wanted to order special , chicken and waffles but was told would take 30 min. Just got short stack, just fair not fully cooked. Other dinner had eggs over.      easy  were over cooked. Toast were two soggy not toasted slabs of bread. Sorry food here simply is not good. Service eas just ok. Can not recommend this place starting with bad seating. Too bad.

3lTS2_PRCdI3FAyfpIQ7TQ.text: The biggest waste of time and $. Bad food bad service. Everyone looks fresh out of jail and or high! No one was intrested in working. If the hotel staff did not recommend them being kid friendly I would not have eaten there!!! Do yourself a favor and eat at one of the other many options around there.

v7Um4qaXcNNWTVHMMz5Cgg.text: AMAZING ! There will be a line but it's worth it ! Shrimp and Grits are a must ! Also the chicken and waffles are delicious with a sweet tea . This place is the real deal!! 5 stars all day

z_u8RSgPvKgKALj81AqAvA.text: The Spagetti was really liquidy and the side salad was just lettuce,cucumber, carrots, and cheese. I'm sure this place is good but don't get the spaghetti

41f0Ee8ciLPwLvwkvPOPxg.text: This place has great food, awesome service, and low prices! You have to try one of their milkshakes too

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

U0PO2O070zNHsa_vsuCL-A.text: Me and friend usually go here after the club the food is always good and hot no complaints there the firecracker shrimp is good the crowd can be a lil weird at that time and wait can be long too I prefer them over midnight diner all day every day

fjR7qynHGAzMXgsMnU9MEA.text: Checked this breakfast joint out in downtown Charlotte.  The best I can do is call this place "average at best".  The food was just "ok" as was the service. Pretty disappointing.  The prices weren't crazy but the food could be better for the prices they charge.

eeYmwqZ0QPbncaMCnK3IsQ.text: I will not return. Been looking for a Brunch place, found it online so went on Sunday Morning. When you walk in the music is so loud and is all Gansta Rap. You would think the Jukebox would have oldies or something since it is suppose to be a 50's diner. Nope, loud Rap music the entire time I'm trying to relax and have brunch. Burger came out quick but it was cold cause the tomatoes on it were ice cold. Staff was good thou but the music drives people away..

9Oow8h_uQjv1RqAL-YCHOg.text: Service is extremely slow. Food was cold and bad. Hard the mess up breakfast food but they did. First and last time coming here

txEZdJrdSn9W7y3VYMlnRA.text: Clean and friendly atmosphere. Instantly transported back to the 60's. The food is fresh, well cooked and the plates are generous. With reasonable prices and really friendly service (Patty was the sweetest!), you can skip the pricey hotel meal and stop by the Red Eye. Their breakfast menu is available all day and I saw a few folks partaking in the chicken and waffles! Stuck to my norm and ordered 2 eggs with hashbrowns and sausage links (which were some of the best I've had).

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

kVpN9_JkEuzsmPXCbMOQjg.text: We came here because it was late at night and the lady at the front desk of our hotel recommended it. It was Friday night in the epicenter so things were kind of crazy. I've never been to a diner that needed a bouncer before. The bouncer, Bubba, kicked some people out, stopped some fights and overall kept the whole place calm. All of the waitstaff was really nice. Great food and they kept the coffee refills coming!

4ue556eq_OAp-1cOqWgD4Q.text: Being from New Jersey, I know what eating at a diner entails... Gotta say this might me the best diner I've been too. Had a chicken tender biscuit sandwich and its was perfect. Great Service, Great Prices and Great atmosphere. Enough said.

kvhuxz5YnLSAbaAQdS5y1g.text: The food at Red Eye was outstanding but the service sets it apart for me. Shannon was our server and she treated us like we were family, guiding us through the huge menu and advising us on how to get the best deal for our money. The fried chicken we had was perfectly tender and not greasy. The biscuits were great, and my salad had the best ranch dressing ever! It blows my mind that this restaurant is 24 hours. SUCH a great experience.

GBAXCB0Fc-5LJzFKUd4ibg.text: Gia was our server, and she ignored us multiple times.  All we wanted was some refills on our drinks and for her to actually pay attention to us.  Worst service at a diner ever.  We wish Joshua was our server because he was alive and ATTENTIVE.  So sad we were treated like this on a Saturday night.

NgpumMR7j4HBvvZ5eLmthw.text: Same exact menu as the midnight dinner which is a bummer. Would be nice for them to have added something new to the menu. Th foods good but nothing special

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. French toast, scrambled eggs

aZGo-bEfZdax44toLjhjhQ.text: If you are looking for gourmet breakfast pass this place on by. However, if you are looking for great biscuits and gravy or the aforementioned wings and waffles, well this is your place here.

hFNvpjZC-HR4E5nO5W8waA.text: This diner is THE BEST in uptown! Management is awesome (Jordan the manager), he personally came over to our table and made sure we were doing well.. he was very friendly and easy to talk to. Miss. Patti was our waitress and she made sure we got all of our food error free and quickly. The food was delicious!!! A personal favorite of mine every time I'm in uptown!

ALq6gnbG4V76_Z7UMkZD5A.text: We LOVED the Redeye Diner.  Customer service was superb, food was great and the prices were very reasonable.  If I ever return to Charlotte, I will definitely return to the Redeye!

Y0pvZLoNpD5gn06n9hIJbg.text: This place should have better reviews.  I thought the breakfast was good and the people were SUPER friendly. Cute diner with good prices

c3nEKceXoXO02-118PKC4A.text: Our first time here and we had an incredible Christmas Eve experience. Our red headed waitress, Emma, was awesome! The food was well prepared and the portions were amazing. I have to say however, our waitress made the whole experience! She was funny, personable and made us feel right at home! My wife had chicken and waffles and I had breakfast (at night) we both loved our meals.. If you stop here to eat, YOU MUST ask for Emma. She will put a smile on your face with her bubbly personality.

cgj_ter98F6J8UF_ttJWuQ.text: What an amazing place, Aisha was the absolute best!  The firecracker chicken sandwich is a must have, not to mention those desserts!!!

qSkZMs3XPz7-iGVmytSSrg.text: Great home cooking. Shannon pointed us toward the fried chicken and she was right. I don't usually eat fried food, but the chicken was freshly fried with terrific batter and very tender. The mac & cheese was great and the ranch dressing was very good, too. Shannon was a great server: knowledgeable and attentive. Very good place to eat.

_7_847Rlz1vgAPXjYJmOxA.text: This is quickly becoming my "go to" diner. Living uptown, it's great having a quality diner to walk to, close to home.  I've told everyone that listens, "Redeye has the best grits in Charlotte". Native to Central Illinois, grits is a dietary staple the past 27 years, ha! Breakfast, burgers, shrimp & grits, fried chicken, fish, you name it, Redeye covers it with quality good, good friendly service and reasonable diner pricing.

E-2bLaDUi-lkJl4MrprtIw.text: My friends and I were walking around the downtown area of Charlotte and wanted to grab something sweet. We were there for a conference but as soon as we walked in, we were greeted. The place is set up like an old school diner, which was really cute. We sat at the bar and ordered a milkshake with two slices of cake a piece. The cake was amazing! It was sweet and delicious. My friend said the milkshake was just as good. You get huge serving which is great for leftovers! Definitely will be back and highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

J_J5qxB-cjNPXlIzFPJc4g.text: Came from out of town and landed late. Great fried chicken that was freshly made late and available 24/7. Batter was perfectly spiced and crispy!  Yummy!

KD3OBIom7gblmgHksnO-zg.text: Redeye, I do give you props for being open 24/7. After a night of brewery hopping you were open. We tried probably 5 places including Soul Gastrolounge, Landmark Diner and didn't like that line at Benny Pennelo's (or the attitude from employees).  The Epicenter area was still very busy. So there's a bouncer at Redeye? I don't know whether to feel secure or scared. Do you need a bouncer and if so why? Moving on.  We only had to wait a couple of minutes before being let in - there were plenty of empty tables and counter space though.  Our waiter was nice enough - the prices were good - the food was good - the service okay. My Bacon Cheeseburger was just what I needed and John H. reported his eggs and corned beef hash fit the bill as well.  The jukebox however was way too loud - not sure I like having my eardrums and my intestines jostled by sound waves while trying to eat.  Overall an okay place to get a late night bit to eat when all others close their kitchens by 10-11PM.

qNNQKJHqUZIPNRyO5s-cRw.text: Very cool, 50's juke box themed diner located in the Uptown Charlotte Epicenter. I had the chicken salad sandwich and admit it was really good. The menu is huge.  My server was beyond amazing. I wish I could remember his name. He really helped me by looking up directions, letting me sit a while and destress after witnessing a traumatic event, and overall just offering great service. He was very kind.Know thy impact.

o_lEVZkGMSHqTfNqcgCWWw.text: Both Redeye and Midnight Diners have the same owners but for some reason the shrimp and grits are much better at Redeye. I can't give an opinion on anything else. I've been to Redeye many times and I always get the shrimp and grits. It's just that good!  The Pros - More space than most well known diners in CLT - Very clean. Ironically, I can appreciate the subtle smell of chlorine bleach in this place. - Fast and friendly service (most nights) - Great variety on menu   Cons - Late nights after nightclubs let out = long lines outside and pushy security  - Not easily accessible. Must park in the parking deck because valet is ALWAYS congested

41GjODVPkTElMnclbVlHwA.text: Coming into this restaurant I noticed there was a now hiring sign. they were not lying. After waiting 15 minutes to be seated, I had to wait another 30 minutes to get our orders taken. Then I had to wait another 15 to get water. After receiving my food which was not hot, needless to say I would never come here again night.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

7dcIXnFoR9Se7EMyOMfRvA.text: Fried chicken dinner was so good.  Creamy grits and collards!  Wish they had cornbread but the rest of the meal was slammin'.  He had breakfast and the French toast were delicious.

k5OBefmh_Wmw-Ok9K5A5yw.text: Went in for a late breakfast with my toddler twins, which is always an adventure.  Right as i enter, i am greeted with a smile and a welcome. The service here is wonderful. Our server was Patrick. He was attentive, patient, communicative, and overall pleasant. He had gone above and beyond to make my experience as best it could be with young twins.   I ate The Bubba, an upgraded version of biscuits with sausage gravy. Super tastey and filling.  Usually made with scrambled eggs on top but I changed it up to a sunny side egg to have extra richness to the biscuits and gravy dish.   Overall good diner food, and Patrick made it a great experience.

DNQ_oVxEafOnBkFvFP7wtg.text: The notion of "24 hours" and "food" just sounds like it's made to go together. Kinda like my other two favorite, "pay" and "day." Seriously, this diner did not disappoint.  The ambiance was unreal due to the game, so it just made for a cool atmosphere (5/5). The service was great still (5/5).  We weren't planning to eat a lot so we stuck with appetizers which were all great (5/5).  These included a cheeseburger slider with fries, chicken noodle soup,  and a side of fries.  We will definitely come again for lunch or supper!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of fries
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cheeseburger slider with fries
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken noodle soup my wife said tasted home made

0X2_aOztY4Cfb5mUeJcbrQ.text: This place has a great location in Epicentre - they have the opportunity to take advantage of getting working professionals during the work day and drunk patrons on the weekend looking for something to eat. And they're a diner - and almost all diners are good, right? Wrong. Unfortunately the food is awful - even when you're drunk! I came here with my friends and fiance after going out in Epicentre one night and we were all very unimpressed. There was a wait to get in, so we patiently waited until a table opened up. And after eating I'm not sure why so many people would wait around for this. I would have rather went home and cooked myself or walked a couple of blocks and grabbed a slice of pizza from fuel.

_m_ItfZvI8FrqZB5QZ1pVg.text: John Smith was our waiter & he was awesome! A complete pleasure. The food was great & if you come here you should definitely ask for him to be your server

ZyYuZG13Ok53_X11ZYyRcQ.text: These are the same owners of midnight diner. It's okay...it's no Johnny Rockets, but for a late night snack, it'll do the trick. The french toast was awesome.

CyMSj6GkoiBlWp-UDXWPww.text: Good food! Great ambiance and great location! I heard about Midnight Diner and never went while we lived here in Charlotte. This was a great breakfast spot to end a great night away for my husband and I. The chicken was good- needed some hot sauce! The creole sauce was delicious!!!! I loved it with the grits.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp and grits

gSHMygx0LuZrYrGLXFOIcA.text: What a great breakfast spot, the food was really good.  We had two eggs over medium with toast/ hash browns, bacon. Really basic.   We ended up adding on a waffle to our order and it was a bit dry, apparently the French toast is the thing to get.  Our server John Smith, I know it sounds like an alias, but that's really his name was great.

txtZxNMav_eI_21bX1mVqg.text: It was decent. Nothing breathtaking in my opinion. Limited seating for large parties.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

l4QPcshl5ODxTTkAG58vPw.text: Found this gem while strolling around the hotel. Our server, John, was very friendly and quick and we liked it!   Got the fish and shrimp platter with waffle fries and coleslaw. Both fish and shrimp very well fried (they weren't greasy, just tender and hot as it should be!). Can't forget about the coleslaw. Just perfect!  Only reason I haven't gave 5 stars was because the Blue Moon I ordered wasn't on tap. I should have asked it before ordering (yes, I'm a beer snob who likes a Blue Moon on the tap with orange on the glass )

0eS_hggdoc23pt7CROz7-w.text: Finally made it to Midnight diner sister restaurant.  This place is just like midnight diner but bigger.  I got the fried chicken and waffles. The waffle is a lil crispy for my liking and you have to use the butter from the packets that on the table. The menu is identified to midnight dinner for those who have been there. They also offer southern staples like collard greens and macaroni and cheese which my fiend got.  I normally stick to the breakfast when I go try the chicken and waffles or the shrimp and grits which is their most popular dishes!

kzCOg_5SPNt9QMldBBQdwQ.text: This is a really well-made (great interior decorating done, great design) 50's-style diner.  The have good grilled cheese sandwiches, and the prices are very reasonable (especially with the Yelp discount!).  The staff is kind and pleasant (and competent).  On this trip I had the fried chicken, with macaroni and cheese and a salad.  It was some of the best (most crispy) fried chicken I had had in my life.  Juicy and tender too!  On my first ever trip to Charlotte, this place was a great find!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
