rIcqU0a8hcaoVP1NM80ETQ.text: Not great   Pros: fast service   Cons: screwed up order, waffle fries were cold. The burger was meh

VIXaF9EPnsB30wuY9cL8ow.text: have to start that I love midnight diner so was excited to see this place open up.  turns out that this place has the same menu but definitely not the same execution or service.  sat at bar and ignored for almost 15 min until I finally got up to get a menu from an uncleaned table and asked the manager if I could place an order.  yes the manager!  she got someone to take my order but that's all they did.   long of it short.  parts of food cold n parts warm like it sat in window because their timing is off, service was non existent, and I saw several managers around but not trying to help with customers or staff.  unless ur absolutely desperate go somewhere/anywhere else!

oMK8QVDJtDNjD-GqzhM4-w.text: Have tried the new Diner twice this week. For only being opened 1 week it is pretty good. The staff seem anxious to please. Got the shrimp and grits. The grits are delicious and creamy. The shrimp were very tiny and not many of them but what was there was tasty.  The music was up way too loud and it was blaring a very distasteful nightclub type music- not appropriate for a family friendly diner atmosphere. Came back and tried breakfast food. Had the grits again, which were wonderful. We were seated near the kitchen and the cooks and expediter were communicating loudly- they need to be quieter to maintain a relaxed environment. This place can be a real gem if they work out the kinks in making the diners feel comfortable.

Khfuzc29Xw_NZJS76fBBkw.text: The workers there are freakin' awesome. They provided excellent customer service as well as making sure we were well entertained! E, James, Jeremiah, and Jordan were the best ! Oh, and Bubba too ! They made our night ! Keep up the good work guys and we will definitely be coming back !

sm0Ien08ZCs8ThkjAGBPnQ.text: Good food at the price point.  This place just opened and the staff seemed well trained and there were none of the rough spots id expect to see during the first couple of weeks a place is open. Very clean.  Only gripe was the steady stream of hip hop ballads blaring from the jukebox monopolized by the staff.

6a1wANEWa9cwyL50LrlQ6w.text: Service for Sunday breakfast was prompt and attentive. Had a great experience and would definitely recommend Redeye as a great place to start the day.

pFIboKVhLfdTESD6BfDU0A.text: Fantastic breakfast!  The coconut crunchy French toast was deeee-lish, service gets 4 stars

HOJ7ZldNobCRy4I6rFtJ6A.text: Food was awesome! Customer service though, not so much. You walk in and are ignored by the host on their phones. Waitress was MIA for almost the entire experience and when we asked another server for some mayo & ranch, there was no answer. Would be back for the food but not staff.

frK2d8AkjhhK6ppD_afETg.text: Great breakfast!! So glad uptown FINALLY has breakfast 24 hours a day. I'm a creature of habit so it's nice to have a good all American breakfast place I can walk to.

TMdcOStxr5i0QScnoCcTMg.text: So the coconut french toast was the best french toast I've ever had! Like really, I've had good stuff other places, but it's crunchy and sweet and the challah bread is so good. Perfect. Obviously I am still dreaming of it...everything else was fine. The service was great and friendly, my sides were good/average, the coffee was strong and the place was super clean. I think we got there before the Sunday rush, so maybe the bad service reviews are when they're super busy or something? Overall I would for sure go back.

tlOA2xX0uiT7PFFJF89LeQ.text: "Never understood why a diner in the heart of the epicentre was always empty. Now I do. Never again... driest burger that I've ever had in 34 years. Took way too long to get seated. Pure trash, don't go.

mg6h7fnqPsnkfuOtHL3f4Q.text: The food was good. However, the service was terrible! I waited over 20 minutes to get my beer. Then over an hour for my food to come out. I asked for honey mustard I didn't get it until I was done with me food. I asked for my check as soon as I got my food expecting it to take a while and had to wait about another 20 minutes after I finished my food. I would understand if they were busy but the place was almost empty. I will not be coming back!

nJavoCO1jiZbUa9ODr_zIQ.text: I'm standing in line waiting to be seated while there are 6 tables open. Why you ask? The kitchen is backed up because they have too many orders coming in at one time. Well, it's easy. You hold open the tables until the kitchen can catch up. Then you seat those open tables all at one time. They then put in orders all at one time guess what? The kitchen gets overwhelmed again. One would think this obvious. Listening to the apparent manager lecture the hostess not to seat anyone, it's VERY clear he doesn't understand. Came for the crunchy French toast. Left because of the inept manager and whacked out system of seating.

loKqFU1AGAaXgRmB3KzKlA.text: Wonderful experience. Great people, fast service and nice to have breakfast food at any time in Uptown.

8b_Bmyuh3CUETsx65wld2Q.text: Five star rating, guys! We're long-time regulars from the Midnight Diner and are just as happy here as we are there. The food is absolutely fantastic, it's given in filling portions for reasonable prices,  the atmosphere is relaxed and styled like a throw-back from the 50's (complete with jukebox!) Add the amazing staff who work here (shout out to Shelly, Shannon, and Dave!!) and Ernie who likes to get to know people as they come in, a couple times here will have you making the Red Eye Diner a regular dining experience in your life. Keep it up, you guys, what you have is something spectacular and I make a point to tell anyone and everyone who asks me.

nyf78efbIC1pACo0ivbAiw.text: The food was horrible the waitress was even worse. So I ordered a caesar salad that came without any caesar dressing. When I tasted it I quickly asked did they put Italian dressing on it. The waitress goes to the kitchen comes back out and said no it doesn't have any dressing I have to get it for you. After giving me the dressing she asked if it tasted better. I told her no. She goes to the kitchen again and comes back and says it was tossed with oil and vinegar which I couldn't understand why. Anyway Manager comes out apologies for food agrees with me that the taste was not right and explains the mistake made by the kitchen (it was tossed with Italian dressing). He agrees to comp my semi eaten salad. As I go to leave the waitress has the audacity to say so I don't get a tip. I continued walking, but then decided she was right. I went back in and gave the manager a dollar and said tell her great job she just bought a customer. By the way the honey cheesy bread tasted amazing too bad I won't be eating it anymore. Sidenote: This isn't my first complaint with the diner just the one I felt needed to be heard.

WO0HcIy8d26iVMAD9Etktw.text: Why in God's name would you bring something so ratchet and tacky at this place to the heart of our beautiful city this is the epicenter a very respected place Management brought the same Midnight Diner mentality the security at the door is ridiculous and has no business dealing with customers I thought I was getting ready to research to go in a club but my service was awesome Tee great the food was awesome the place is spotless and clean it made me forget the bull crap at the door until it was time to leave my survey wrote paid and signed my check that wasn't good enough for the two big guys at the door they sent me back to get a red stamp as if there were going to force me to stay because they had other people to run off on the check I say again you brought that ratchet mentality to the heart of our beautiful city it would have been better for you increase your food prices to offset some of your losses

WyMjypaqiFU3DfK5KJGDoQ.text: Prices are affordable for what you get. Service is quick and friendly. Food is well prepared. Atmosphere is fun but could use some deep cleaning.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Good food, good price!

z6zsqt0e75AmO_XagF9i6w.text: I walked in to a manager on the phone (at the greeters stand) with someone who was sick or something (she says I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO TELL YOU BUT I'M NOT COVERING YOUR SHIFT); didn't speak to me but got off the phone and said someone would be with me.  Eventually someone ask if I was dining in or carrying out.   I was sent to a register(a full staff and still none of them spoke); Tye finally acknowledges my presence. Then she tells me someone will be with me shortly, she then proceeded to take the order of the couple that came in after me.   Really unfortunate experience, the only person that seemed to be concerned with presentation was Ashley, I've been recommending this location to guest staying at my hotel, I'm no longer comfortable doing so.  Very disappointing,

7gPdUOLjlDK0cOOFFe3xQw.text: Must try! They have breakfast, lunch and dinner! Fast service and delicious food! I would definitely come back again. Greeted and seated as soon as we walked in, pretty busy, and still awesome service!

iqFSB2aUTRGFaTYr3d8ftg.text: Amazing classic diner down in Charlotte. Ordered the fried chicken and waffles, but John Smith recommended substituting French toast for the waffles. Boy am I glad John Smith was serving us... thanks John Smith!

IsI2PuETZGIDsdlGHRZY5Q.text: BEST GRITS EVER!  The rest of the breakfast was was awesome as well.  Found this place via Yelp with other great reviews and I'm on the 'loved it' bandwagon.  Atmosphere, service, music playing (Christmas songs).  Definitely recommend.  Props to Sydney and trainee Is a for outstanding service.

x2n7P_tfW7oytdTVA_tR8A.text: I really liked this place enough to eat there twice on my visit. Everytime Ms Fab was my server...she was a sweetheart and provided valuable suggestions. The grits are a must have! The waffle fries were better than chick fil a's which is almost impossible to beat. The fried chicken was good and reheated nice. Skip the french toast, greens, and wings(they're ok at best). So many other things to choose from

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. This chicken was amazing

WaQshy71jxpoWeThH0MVmA.text: You've downed a couple of drinks at the Epicenter and you're ready to end the night with some drunk food.  At this point, everything is going to be delicious whether you remember it or not.  One item that I did thoroughly enjoy was their garlic teriyaki wings because they're not dunked in the sauce like your typical wings but drizzled, which left the wings quite crispy.    Overall, this place isn't going to disappoint you after a late night of partying but I would definitely recommend trying to beat the 2am rush.

VFxyaIO-S1OcGjilHkRbUw.text: We eat twice here, in the evening and the following morning.  If just based on the evening I would have given it 4 stars but the breakfast let it down. The RedEye Is in the EpiCenter which makes it very convenient to the Spectrum and many of the downtown hotels.  Prices are very reasonable considering the location.  My wife had a really nice Greek Salad with Grilled chicken added I had the Philly Chesesteak with fries.  Both were very good, prepared quickly and our server was attentive with drink refills etc.  We were pleased and decided to go back for breakfast.   Just fruit for my wife, I had the Eggs and Corn-beef hash.  I wasn't asked how I wanted my egg so they can scrambled, I guess that was sort of my fault, hash browns were not included, the waitress didn't ask either, I ordered the muffin and had to remind the waitress as it didn't come with my rather plain looking breakfast plate.  No real milk or half and half only liquid Coffee Mate was available.  Coffee refills were adequate.    The place is clean, the 50-60s music is fun.  Being a Jersey guy I'm really spoiled by great diners.  We would go again.  I'd try the pancakes next time.

WbcZezXlsI_YYz2pZAK01g.text: My wife and I ate an early dinner here after watching a play. The food was good. I had chicken and waffles and my wife had the veggie burger. The food came out quickly. The best part was the service. Our server, John Smith, was the perfect combination of attentive without being intrusive. A good evening out.

FH31ocRrR20ejaakE2xDKQ.text: We came late night when the line was out the door and wrapped around. Really wanted to try so convinced my husband to stay and surprisingly enough the line moved quick! Maybe 10 mins max! Sat at the bar area - super fast service and cheap awesome diner food. Everyone was ordering the chicken and waffles or the shrimp and grits looked great must be the hits on the menu/  Hit the spot for greasy diner food! Will be back and a plus they serve Breakfast all day. I love breakfast anytime!

CIDajdrCDT9aU2ZuaAufeA.text: I was in town for CIAA weekend and this was the closet 24/7 place to eat from my hotel. My waiter Adrien was very good and showed great customer service. I was going between the shrimp and grits and the French Toast, and I ended up getting the Coconut Crunch French Toast with strawberry topping, egg whites, hash browns and, turkey sausage. The sausage was a bit dry while the rest of my food was somewhat cold, and I think the strawberries should of been on top instead of the side. The hash browns was a bit greasy but edible. I enjoyed it and was fulfilling before my flight back to NY. I'm sure after the clubs that they have in the area it's a great place to eat. I can say it's better then Denny's but not better than IHOP but they have a better selection.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Eye Diner... coconut crusted French toast with hash brown, egg whites, and turkey sausage &amp; a strawberry composite.

KS9E9pilmxmXjGedWWweLw.text: I love the idea of this place so much! It is exactly what the Epicentre needs if only the execution of this place was decent.  We stopped by to a half empty establishment around 7pm on a Saturday night. There was no one around to seat anyone so we had an awkward wait right up front trying to decide if we wanted to stay or go somewhere else. An unhappy hostess asked how many and showed us to a large booth to the back where we proceeded to wait almost ten minutes until a manager asked if we had been served. She went and found us a waiter and we promptly ordered.  The best dish of the night was the appetizer of firecracker shrimp. Not spicy as anticipated but delicious sauce. I ordered the California Burger "well done" to which the waiter told me all the burgers are cooked well done. Great! He disappeared for a bit and came back with our burgers and then later with our appetizer.   Now my burger was okay until I got to the middle and found pink. Esh. Waiter was nowhere in sight to point this out to so I ate my waffle fries and continued enjoying the company I was out with. Getting the check was a task.   All said the three of us were there over an hour and a half when it was not busy for mediocre food. I will say the prices were cheap considering we were in the Epicentre but it's definitely not somewhere I would seek to eat at again.

dEU3Y9w_V_8g--0iuU0Bcw.text: I have to say I was looking for a place to have dinner close to my hotel, and happened upon this cute little diner. I had the fried chicken, greens and mac n cheese. I also had the banana pudding for dessert. OMG the fried chicken was sssoo good.. yes it's a little greasy but come on they just made it it's going to be. The mac and cheese was perfect just like I was craving.. and the greens had a really good flavor and not over cooked. I was looking for a small meal and ended up over eating it was so good.  I did like the banana pudding too.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. I couldn&#39;t eat it because I was so full from dinner but ordered it to go!
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken, greens and mac and cheese!
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waiting for the famous chicken..

LM4iJTGtkzxEpvIpPhvmIg.text: A solid diner. The food was good and the service was speedy. I really enjoyed the music-themed decor and their chocolate chip pancakes. The portions and prices were also very reasonable.

y2QgWiBJ-EBlVBlnlA8o8w.text: This review is long overdue, as I was here back in October for my cousin's wedding. I think the reason I hesistated in writing a review is because I wasn't sure how to eloquently describe just how excellent the chicken and waffles are at this restuarant.   Imagine dying. Not to sound morbid or anything, but just imagine it. Imagine your life, flashing before your eyes. All the beautiful memories, the laughter, all the friends you had, a life full of enjoyment. And that's just the first bite.  Seriously, if you live in Charlotte and haven't been here yet, you're doing yourself a serious diservice. Everything looks fantastic and it is c-h-e-a-p! The waitstaff is friendly as can be, and the service is pretty quick, even at odd hours of the night. Definite A+

lNpbXEwh0XnCpYEWi2StwQ.text: Good food, excellent grits service was slow, our waitress was very distracted and to busy. Ask for coffee served the coffee but no cream, food arrived but cutlery for a wile in fact she is the reason why is not 4 stars.

IOyOHiJHB8NmAMvY5fMZ7w.text: We went here for brunch on Thanksgiving Day during the parade in Uptown. The staff were all checked out talking about partying, going out, etc. very loudly across the restaurant. Some of the staff were complaining about having to be there. On top of all their yelling, the music in the restaurant was incredibly loud to the point where we had to ask the manager to turn it down.  The food was okay. Nothing special, even with all of the many options on the menu. You can't really mess up breakfast. I can imagine this is a good place for all the drunk people out on the weekends.

DZ1biwGrqmXLIJcTWzO8VA.text: Food is average nothing special. Can't go wrong with their breakfast all day menu. Service is pretty slow. Nice staff.

Q3g7yxaVmQAJsM_dqTKL5Q.text: Fast service great food chicken is so good onion rings mac and cheese plus a biscuit I didn't ask for I will Def return

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great

TRQoKOmb5y1R3Qc7h7TlIw.text: Food and atmosphere were great, however the service is the star attraction here.  Pat was probably the best waiter I've ever had.  Extremely attentive and you can tell he's having fun with his job.  Menu offers all the common diner comfort foods.  Chicken and waffles looked great and can be ordered with French toast instead of waffles.  My omelette was great and I will definitely be back.

3N7U85xKM0fqhBMEa8v4-w.text: I ordered $100 worth of food to go for my friends who were visiting town and when I left Redeye, I was chased down by their staff in my Uber because they were claiming that I did not pay for my meal. They never identified themselves or asked for a receipt, they just chased down my Uber, banged on the door of the moving car then accused me to stealing food. I then reached out to corporate and all I got was an in-genuine apology from Jennifer Eanes. She did not offer me a gift card or any compensation for my horrible experience and I am very disappointed with her service and Redeye in general. DO NOT GO HERE.

GutVFkJbldLf-1br1o7pkA.text: OK, I love diners, but this is a little different. It's sort of I want to be an old diner, but I'm really just have a nostalgic look. Made the mistake of trying to get in the morning of The Belk Bowl football game! Big mistake. Long wait, but we held out until we got seated. there was another pretty long wait to get waited on and yet another to get served.  I don't think it's lack of servers. The place was crawling with uniformed diner staff and frankly everyone looked to be working very fast, but were they efficient? our food was served hot. We had a standard breakfast of sorts, eggs, toast, grits, etc. The coffee was OK, but not great. Seemed fresh brewed. I might try it again in the future, but I suspect there are other good breakfast joints near downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Breakfast
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

e18toX0X0qmMHVT6JEnKUA.text: I came in to the Red Eye Diner and the food was excellent. The collard greens was exceptional to say the least and Darrell our waiter was superb and very attentive. He rocks!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

FIhvi_joXe49hFb6gpl4-g.text: The food is ok not great. The presentation of the food was poor. The prices are competitive but the presentation of the food made this place last choice for me. The floor was dirty and our server was not attentive to us.   This was my first time here I will come back and hope my 2nd experience is better than the initial one.

AHLReByMBkRgSOZ_ptlXaA.text: Horrible Experience!!!  Went here with my family and waited and waited...... NoOne waited on us and it was our first time here.  We left and and no one still acknowledged us!  NEVER WILL COME AGAIN!

TXF0YULv9yhY0LFrqYzmAQ.text: I love this diner, I've never dined in but every takeout order I've had they've nailed  it, breakfast or lunch it doesn't matter, call in or walk in to order, same great food.  Many times I've ordered grits with sauteed spinach, mushrooms and tomatoes, not on the menu but they accommodated with no problem.  Chocolate chip pancakes or waffles no problem, hamburger steak with collard greens and mashed potatoes....legit!  Now, has service been slow a few times, definitely but the food makes up for it and it won't stop me from going back.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hamburger steak with mushrooms, onions and gravy with mashed potatoes and greens

tW21ryWOxe6QYdMEXKbqOQ.text: Place is decent for a diner. Food was quick and as usual the menu was extensive. Like that they also sell alcohol

hTWmFTnzvvMHH9MUJmMX7w.text: French Toast is super yummy.. staff is pretty cool. My daughter loves the pancakes. It's really busy on the weekends.

tH0ToghWqgBZxbiVUFyGaQ.text: One thing I feel Charlotte needs more of is quality, clean, fast serving 24 hour diners. And that's exactly what you get at Redeye.   We had a party of five on a Friday night, about 11 pm and the place was slightly busy.The diner is surprisingly large with ample seating. The menu has plenty of dish selections without overwhelming you with an encyclopedia of options. The service was good enough to be engaging but not overbearing or extra. Pancakes were huge and I highly recommend the grits. These grits weren't that bullshit watered down style grits...no no no! They were thick and creamy based with just enough salt. I got cheese with my grits but next time I won't because the grits are GOOD MONEY by themselves w/ out adding cheese...but if you do add it I can't fault you.  My only knock on Redeye is the pricing. Not that the prices were crazy extreme or anything like that. I guess I'm used to diners being a little more price friendly. I have been to several other comparable diners in Charlotte where the price of the food is better. But then in hindsight you have to take in consideration that Redeye is located practically in the heart of uptown Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles. I gave a 8 out of 10.
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Redeye Special platter....GRITS were on point!

PjmgEujIQlqMlyJqLElVHg.text: Ordered the chicken and waffles, chicken was fried perfectly and was juicy and flavorful. Waffle resembled cake in texture and taste. The presentaron was underwhelming, just a waffle and chicken on the plate. Friend ordered the Bubba, "famous biscuit" was a bit dry and cheese on top under the egg wasn't even melted when brought to our table.

CXX9rf7wljF4bzZVJo24ig.text: It's nice to see a 24-hour diner in the heart of uptown Charlotte, even though I am past the age where I need to have a place to eat after the bars close. We stopped here on a Saturday morning after the Charlotte Heart Walk. The place is much bigger than it appears from the outside and also appeared clean with a sanitation grade of 96. Photos and memorabilia of rock and country music stars adorn the walls to give it a True diner atmosphere.  We were seated fairly promptly although it was a little busy because of the walk. Our waiter was prompt and helpful with service, and even sometimes a little too quick. I had an egg and cheese biscuit and the biscuit was perfect - most and fluffy and fell apart. The hashbrowns were also good with the right amount of crispiness. Egg-white omelette was also good despite the canned mushrooms they use.  Prices were fair for most items except the egg-white omelette, which was almost $13 (regular omelettes are cheaper). Most breakfast items were comparable to other diner places. They also have full entries such as steak and fried seafood. Overall, a good experience and I would go back.

HPKG5tFXoED0JrA64GRTeA.text: Fantastic food. Great location. Really a good atmosphere and great people. Prices were normal. A+. We were there due to a cancellation on our flight. They helped us feel better after hours at the airport!

URjG0lQTC_eBZrfLrV-BWg.text: August 20th. We show up cause we've been told that the food is good. The bouncer wannabe/ security stops us at the door and blocked us. Think he had a problem cause we were Mexican. He finally let us in after a few word exchanges. We ordered our food and drinks and waited for our food. He came inside to our table while we minded our own business and was trying to intimidate us. Pretty much kicked us out. He was trying to make us pay for the food and drinks. This guy totally has a problem with Latinos(racist). Don't eat here! You've been warned. Sorry waitress, it ain't our fault we left. This guy had dreadlocks and glasses.

mXSJi-FioxqxaCjZzE4rug.text: I ordered pick up, when I got there my card swipe was damaged and for some reason they didn't have a way to type it in manually. I ordered chicken and waffles with a chocolate milkshake. If your card doesn't swipe and you don't have cash you're screwed, I don't know if they need to update their system but typing in cards manually is the oldest form of card payment. Their chicken was very bland even thought it had texture. Their waffles are extremely dry even when drowned in syrup which doesn't make sense. The customer service was okay, but I won't be going back unless for their dessert milkshake which was better than the food.

KHLlzrlnV0euQWzQGJ5fEA.text: I ordered the shrimp and grits, and it did not disappoint. Amazing! Our server, Mo, was the sweetest and her service was spot on. She's very friendly and attentive. We're visiting Charlotte for the evening, but reassured, we'll be back!

tBFKkwSSS8YX7HRdTmyXCg.text: Service was great. John and Crystal were very attentive and friendly. Food was great too.

pGifU-ldsXGjSRnvDdanWA.text: Redeye Diner has done it again! Another incredible meal, recommended by another friendly and attentive server. As I was waffling (teeheehee) between chicken & waffles and the special, I asked our server Braxton what he would recommend. He suggested chicken & french toast, a tasty and delightful (off-menu) combination that tickled my tastebuds and was super satisfying.   Redeye Diner's servers really are dedicated to serving their customers. I am always warmly greeted upon entrance, and the servers personalities are allowed to shine.  The only issue with Redeye Diner is that EpiCenter parking is so expensive that I don't get to hang out and drink bottomless coffee as long as I would like. I wish EpiCenter had some sort of ticket validation program.  Regardless, I will be back...the chicken & waffles (or french toast) are some of the best the Queen City has to offer!

wsE-SECohCWUznqjWTBfsA.text: I really like this diner. I have eaten here the past two times I was in Charlotte and each time I was pleased with my food and service. I got the pancake meal which came with three pancakes, a biscuit, eggs, and a breakfast meat. We also ordered a coffee, milk, and apple juice. I was a little surprised that this all came out to like $30 including the tip (I did add two extra biscuits just in case my children were ravenous). But technically for 3 people that isn't horrible. It is just that three people shared one meal.  I will say that the staff is very casual in their dealings with the customers but still very friendly. I would definitely eat here again. It's simple breakfast comfort food with generous serving sizes, comfy seating, and a relaxed atmosphere.

-Hy4hPuP7YxLKbHnGXvT_w.text: Great service and great atmosphere.  Lots of choices and great music.  John at the bar was a ton of help and a lot of fine to have as a server.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Come check out John.  Best server in town.

8ZaDx-ijuOlS0QxY45sJlg.text: This place is over priced for frozen reheated food.  This is worse then a continental breakfast at a hotel.  The waffle was not sweet and lacked in flavor.  The pancakes were frozen and reheated.  Check your ticket because they will charge you more than the listed menu price.

H3O2zQLoPUSWV_YetNoddA.text: Late on a Tuesday night (10pm) = good luck finding food in Uptown. I didn't get to eat before going to the show at Blumenthal, and headed toward EpiCenter to find food afterward. Hopping Epi looked more like a ghost town on a Tuesday night. Redeye Diner was open, so diner I went.  I ended up with a cup of the chicken noodles ($1.99) - which amazingly did taste like homemade! I also had a chili dog ($$4.24), but make sure you tell the server you also want everything else on it with the chili or you will only get chili and the dog (they did get me chopped onions & relish upon my request).   Overall it was better than I expected. Not cheap, but I couldn't expect anything less simply from a "supply & demand" standpoint.

0544tO2m28gQ_bMCntgvOg.text: Service was alright. We waited by the "please wait to be seated "sign for a couple minutes. The staff saw us but did not even acknowledge us until someone emerged from the back to seat us. My husband ordered a BLT he said it was alright. The fresh fruit he ordered as a side was fresh and good. I went with a waffle which was pretty awful. The "compote" that you pay a dollar extra is pretty much canned pie filling. Overall it's overpriced diner food catered to drunk people. I would rather eat at Moe's on the second floor.

DD5NjND41pDG_9uQQU3_CQ.text: Lashonda is awesome server!!!!  Great food, atmosphere and all-around friendly place.  Well priced.  Will be back!!!!

iPBskYlpNXIkRDK2T2oDNQ.text: Not the place to go if you like your burgers cooked anything less than well, but our meals were tasty (firecracker shrimp, palls pecan blue cheese salad, chicken noodle soup, and hash and eggs ). Wait staff was very attentive   We were seated quickly and food seemed to magically appear.

C8fh4MphvVppHhU6fQUDMA.text: We ordered delivery and was blown away by the food! The Fried Chicken was seasoned perfectly and went well with the pecan waffles. Will definitely order from them again!

WJxxyIRGxo2AlSbB2OWpLw.text: I'm a little late with my review, but who cares! So, this was my first time at the Redeye Diner and I have to say I loved it! From the decor to the music... Everything about this place screams family and late night/early afternoon lunch with friends.  Just a few things that I would like to point out, not sure if this is the normal for this restaurant, but business was slow and my waitress was a little slow with assistance. Placed my order and my food was ready within a few minutes of me placing my order. My burger was great but I wasn't really digging my fries much because a lot of them were to crispy or hard to eat... And I don't like crispy ass fries! But needless to say, it was a good deal and I enjoyed every minute of it. I would recommend anyone to come and be apart of the Redeye Diner experience and get a feel for the blast from the past. Tell your friends or relatives and make a trip to an epic night at the Epicenter's Redeye Diner.

8YFos8PkwHA-z7fr36SGQA.text: I want back to this restaurant and the manager greeted me respectfully and gave me a great table with a view he appreciated our business, they must have changed the cook because  the food was phenomenal I recommended you to this place..  I wouldn't recommend going at night because you get a lot of thugs and large crowds .. waiting you're probably get Prison Shank after 12 a.m. so be on guard and don't drop the hand sanitizer..

z0YVMylPPqaExqhzl_tCkA.text: Staying at the Omni and had a late dinner here. Benjamin was hands down one of the best waiters we've had at any restaurant during our travels. Friendly, attentive, and charming. A real gem of a waiter. The food was fresh and amazing. Definitely will come back!

k0Z_FVtNw6uVxWwJ8LLp4A.text: Great atmosphere, our server Uriah was amazing! Came for drinks and desserts and all of her recommendations were on point!

PnbRhhwNY4i7nYrfEA_Uvg.text: I had a terrible experience here last night due to your over zealous bouncer at the door who refused to allow us entry because I mentioned having to use the restroom. We were actually going to eat and do eat here late nights. He straight up profiled me, probably assuming I left Bubble, and treated me like my business wasn't welcomed when it is every other time and when my and guests money are being spent. You should really address him (the one who choked someone out last week) about being more customer friendly. He is the reason I gave this place a 1 star and I will be very sure to tell ALL my guests to stay away.

mrH1lLeOxYo5WjpllZXLZw.text: Great food and really cute atmosphere, but the service has been consistently sub-par. I've been a few times for lunch, each time has been before the rush, yet we still felt like we were "forgotten" a few times throughout the meal. The brain freezes are delicious though, if you're looking for a sweet treat!

ho8pKZ89a3DUcvNdsbw32w.text: I thought my grandma made the best grits - but this place is unstoppable (sorry grandma!). Food was delicious on all accounts - a great place to stop in if you visit NC.

lYXhWnuyk8xyBsbP55yQWQ.text: Come check us out.  The best spot in uptown.Great food.  Fantastic desserts and great service.

bq01fF7FBF0OF7g4eadCyg.text: Good place to go late at night if you're drunk. This afternoon it was filthy and I waited for 20 minutes for a waiter to show up. It didn't happen and I left.

yXmC_rpWzouJSZQdxyk9Kw.text: It started out great with our server but fell quickly. Food was not very good and as stated the service fell by the wayside.

gwgoBncNamhSpfbmMVPumA.text: Breakfast at Red Eye this morning was perfect. Hit the spot! Met my friend for a late Saturday breakfast and opted to sit at the bar. After reading so many reviews about slow/poor service I had my doubts but Sonny took excellent care of us and we got out food in less than 10 minutes.   The pancakes were cooked to perfection and everything we ordered came out to our expectation.   Loved the interior and thought the place was super cute!

nvaA4JDtB1-5LLU_kdJ9OQ.text: The atmosphere of this 'diner' was what appealed to me and located in a great location. The atmosphere was ok but mainly superficial with its look. It was busy with a short wait but it is a Saturday night.  The service was ok but nothing worth raving about and most staff seemed to look past you. I sat at the counter and the young female server was friendly and helpful but also filling drink orders as they came in.  The food.. well.. disappointing. The house salad was well and Truely pre-prepared and average in taste and presentation served on a really cold plate giving away it's prepared earlier in the day and sitting in the fridge status. I had the Lee's Special fried chicken and fries too. The fries were 'fresh' cut and relatively tasteless along with the chicken. Whilst the chicken was fresh tasting the coating was average and nothing new.  Overall I would certainly try alternatives around the city before here.I was definitely looking forward to eating here after hearing good things about it but sadly was ordinary.

01-9lPS0Q6oND-ADqNfe9A.text: Midnight Diner's red headed step child. Same menu pretty much so idk why the name is different. I order from midnight diner all the time with no issues. Even with lines out the door around the corner. Come here once my order is completely messed up. And of course I ordered it to go and didn't realize until I got home.   Ordered a veggie burger, got fried chicken. Bf ordered 2 egg breakfast with cheese and with country ham and hashbrowns all the way. He got eggs without cheese but covered in gravy. No country ham. Hashbrowns didn't have ham or onions, just cheese. Literally none of the food was correct.

NvC0RvX47vhTVXKWVrT2XA.text: Food was good until my wife but on an egg shell.  This is so disappointing that I wish it had not had happen. Got the delivery from Postmates and the food was hot and good just the egg shell.  Might give them one more try in the distant future..

vsfhuv4ivhCZnb89aJnrNQ.text: Wonderful and fun diner experience! Food was good and very affordable! Fried chicken and collard greens side were the highlights. Recommend coming for a quick, indulgent, and low cost bite.

4AyTUoN00OOS9EkLrPBl8w.text: Great to see a place uptown give 24/7 hours. Food and service is nearly identical to midnight diner so you know what to expect.   Decor is awesome and they have a great patio. Food isn't mind blowing but it's simple and easy diner food.

Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

D3HQorffRnqmoClMLDzxwQ.text: Food cooked to order.  Ron was spot on with his recommendations for us being first-time customers.  Good service and the food was great!

_KFUpDBMuTp8xacQYutQ4Q.text: Food. Ice cream. Cake. And a bar. In a diner. What more do you need? And what a fun place! Great service from friendly, fast, funny servers, and great, simple diner food. Fried chicken, onion rings and fish sandwich all had a perfect breading, and the chicken was so moist and tender the bones just fell out. Want to go back for the desserts!!

ojy0tQTPGJXQSbke4d6jDQ.text: omo.  I have never in my life been to a diner like this. It looked like something out of a museum (there's nothing like this in East Cobb for sure!). Diner girls in skater dress, red booths, mirrors on the walls, old school jukeboxes, all in the Epicentre!  Some people on this page have reviewed this place as too expensive and I'm just like WAT. Everything here is basically less than $10. The drinks are amazing btw, come here not for the food but for the drink specials.  I never thought I'd go to a diner and sit at their bar, but their two $5 drink specials are ones you can't miss. A tall glass of a cocktail of spirits that usually tastes fruity but alcoholic, and delicious. Order a platter of diner food or chicken and waffles at 1AM and you'll be ready for the rest of the night.

TlamdFZhregfpCmB56wQJw.text: We were there at 9pm and I asked the waitress what she recommends she said the fried chicken. I ordered it and it was dry and tasteless! I didn't eat any of it after just a couple of bites. Waitress never refilled our drinks and we were obviously a detraction  from her flirting with regulars! Service horrible! My friends that got the BLT had two pieces of bacon. Just not enjoyable! Staff was there to just have fun and not serve their clients. Bad attitudes! I will not go back!

Ve3CC7Z-VND0oO-Ja5TXaw.text: Pros:  Food was good and our waitress was awesome! Cons:  Not family friendly Staff cursing throughout the restaurant Music being played had cursing  I went to the diner because my children thought is had a "cool look." We were promptly seated by the host,  but I thought it was odd that it was the only restaurant in the EpiCenter not crowded.  Our waitress was very attentive and made good suggestions, which were spot on. HOWEVER, we had to listen to one of the employees complain and curse about someone who we believe works there.  He just kept walking around the entire restaurant talking about this person.  Management said nothing.  The music was not a problem until several songs about sex and curse words were playing..nothing done by management.  Not a family friendly establishment and won't be coming back.

NeIsxJlSH1ZvikKH-MdBOw.text: Ok...so I'm literally sitting here and came the bar area...no one, for about 10-15 mins, asked us did we need any help. Finally, someone came over and addressed us but they acted as if they were doing me a favor. They have too much staff and they still suck!  So...I just only wanted to grab something quick so I could go to work. Not only were they inattentive, but she didn't relay the same service to me (as the others...I notice a lot) and I passive aggressively conveyed that to her. The service was so horrid, I didn't even order food.    All in all, if you want to be unattended to and deal with shitty service, come to Red Eye Diner! They'll definitely deliver on that!!

lfbT5K14LHLrBaDn8fokJw.text: READ PLEASE.  After going to a number of restaurants for breakfast and being told the wait would be 30-40 minutes around the 11 o'clock hour, we ended up here and were pleasantly surprised.  Customer Service: We were seated immediately. Our server CASSANDRA was on top of things the entire time. She took our drink and food orders right after being seated, and checked our drinks very consistently. GREAT SERVICE!   Food: We ordered the Bubba and the Greek omelette. Everything was warm and cooked well. The food was good, but not great.   For being a diner, it's definitely worth a try!

xXN4-euMzklTZG_yjC8MIA.text: I ordered chicken and waffles.  The waffle was too crispy.  I could not pick it up with a fork.  I was told by Kaely that once you pour the syrup on the waffle, it is hard to pick up.  Really?  I had her to replace it with french toast which was good.  The chicken came to the table sitting in grease.  The second picture is one of chicken wings which had a broken bone while cooking so that is the bone marrow.  I had to use a napkin to drain it and it had feathers on it.....gross!  Kaely, our server, clearly did not want to be here.  UPDATE:  Because Kaely felt the need to scold me thru Yelp, I am now giving this place a 1!

Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. I could not pick up the waffle with a fork.  The fried chicken came to the table sitting in grease.

MjA69XaxhxsTamc_IzyQng.text: Menu is a trap! If you order the redeye special, know that it is a choice between grits, hash browns, or fruit. It isn't a choice between grits and fruit in addition to hash browns. Because of the poor use of semantics, I was tricked into being under the impression that I was getting my choice of grits or fruit in addition to hash browns and the rest of the food that come with the special. I thought i was getting a good deal. I wasn't. When I brought it to the attention of our server she did nothing to fix the wrong and rarely returned to our table. Finally, while we were paying the manager (I think) came to our table and asked us how the meal was. I also brought to her attention the ambiguity in the menu and was met with the same lack of help as our sever. I was dumbfounded by the utter lack of customer service. I attached the description of the meal that was so unclear (the redeye special). Two members of our party were under the same impression as I was. This restaurant was recommended by our concierge and will let him know not to recommend this restaurant to anyone else as it was so disappointing. I will not be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

0KkH_DM6N5bPirQzvoG5JA.text: This is not a review for the food, as their computers were down and unable to process our food order. This review should be read by management as tips to help their business going forward.  1. If your computers are down, advise customers at the door, so we can make a decision on whether we wish to sit and wait or not.  2. If your computers are down, that should NEVER stop the ordering or paying for food!! Servers can write the order and get a manager to walk it back to the kitchen. Advise customers you can only accept cash at that time (I doubt any one will leave their cc information with staff in this day and age).  3. If you have customers in the restaurant when the computers go down, and the wait is more than 5 minutes, have the manager go to each table and apologize for the inconvenience. That simple act goes a long way (unless you don't care about repeat customers). Maybe even offer a free beverage.  There are other things I could mention, but this is a start. Hopefully, it's helpful.

9YIOEaa0oC6EVNTExOh0rw.text: I went with the BFF during Hoshicon weekend.  I am not one that needs pleasantries from the waitstaff - just get my order right, don't make me wait too long (without acknowledgement), ask me if I need anything once or twice, and give me an accurate bill!  In short, the waitress/manager met my requirements.  We both ordered the shrimp and grits...  OMG, I don't think I ever had grits that good in my life!!!  Very creamy!  The shrimp was plump and not overcooked.  Sadly, I could not eat the biscuit that went along with it - too full from the grits - lol.  I visit Charlotte often so I will definitely come back (if only to try the fried chicken and waffles or the shakes, which I scoped while waiting for my order).    I am surprised by all the bad reviews, but I have a pragmatists view when it comes to 24 hour diners in general, the quality (sadly) is sometimes contingent on time that you go (we went in the late afternoon when it was not too crowded).

slkAPSJgno-6OeC2TtZWYQ.text: I ordered the shrimp & grits and requested them with no spice, now I can understand if your Creole gravy is pre-made by the batch, not an issue but SAY THAT!!  Admit that the gravy is what it is and don't just say "no spice, you got it" and when I come to get my call in order and ASK if it was made with no spice, don't say "no spice, just like you asked". For the love of Mike, I could hardly eat the blasted thing!!  If the sauce is unchangeable SAY THAT, I would have ordered something else. Also I ordered a slice of chocolate cake, last time I got it the cake itself had been sliced at some earlier point, so one side was all crunchy crumbs...same thing this time, it's a pretty pricey slice of cake COVER THE CUT EDGE and please give me my whole slice next time. *see photo

KlNL8dhBszvTMm4X5mdVow.text: Came here after participating in March for Our Lives demonstration with many other marchers. While we were being seated I overheard another waiter say "I don't like serving protesters." I asked him, "Are you for real?" He said, "I was just joking." I should have left then. I ordered a hamburger, medium, only to be told it was not available. "We only cook our burgers well done." Strike 2. Then Waffle fries arrived cold. Strike 3. To top it off,  when my friend gave waitress $20 bill to pay her $10.40 ticket, she returned with $9, no change. She assumed the change was hers to keep, and I guess she was right because that's the tip she got for being so presumptuous. 4 strikes and your out, Red Bird Diner.

2kjy4fa7kvNTm1ahDgi9YQ.text: It was late, and I wandered into the center looking for some grub. I was hungry. Hungry for something a bit greasy.   I stepped into Redeye, where I was greeted and taken to my table. I was thinking I would just get a burger. I went through the menu, and decided on the fried chicken.  The description sounded good, and my server said she ate that dish all the time. 1/4 dark with a biscuit and 2 sides. $9.99.  Sold.  For my two sides, I opted for collard greens and onion rings.  The chicken was indeed crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. It tasted hot and fresh. Better than I've had most recently elsewhere. They fried it well because it was not dripping in grease. I usually love collard greens, but this was just ok.  As for the onion rings, they were excellent as well. Usually restaurant onion rings have a weird crust that is like corn meal and betray the fact that they came in a giant 50-lb. frozen bag. Not here, the crust had the texture of fresh batter. I can't guarantee that; it just tasted good. The onion inside was also natural tasting. If you're a fan of onion-rings, it's easy to tell good from bad.  All in all, the food was good. Service was quick and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with collard greens and onion rings.

aVBUh0g-Hv8Vb5ShT2b-xw.text: Anne Kareen was an awesome server and very attentive. Our refills never went below halfway and left happy. Will definitely come back and ask for her if In town.

al8kcPTrQqWk696K7bsPxQ.text: Went in to order some food and got a skinny wanna B rastafarian with dreads basically stop me at the entrance and ask me "What am o doing or are you getting take out...nah man I'm just ordering food inside I said is that all right??  It was like he wanted to be like a customs officer or  bouncer..I walk in and I'll be damn if the cashier chick and him were laughing about the situation that unfolded and took place..Well my advice 4 him...Smell the Maxwell house and wake up it ur wheaties b4 You step to me again..The next dude might not be as nice as me! REAL TALK

The service is always top notch and attentive. Great price, great food, great service - nothing bad about it. Plus, it's always fun to feel like you are in a Diner!

duAIqaO0z8KvrrI5b21UnA.text: In Charlotte, NC near our hotel, we stopped in for dinner at this diner. It was located in a Food Court behind the Bus Terminal.This place was very cool looking with its retro decor and jukebox which played old time songs while we were there. The waitress came to take our order in 10 minutes. I ordered a vanilla milkshake which was the best I have ever had! I also ordered pancakes that came sprinkled with confectioners sugar. My husband ordered fried chicken. It was delicious.The food came out within a reasonable time but mine was cold so it was sent back. I waited along time before the pancakes came back. I would have rated a 5 otherwise. The food was very good. The place was empty and the service was awful! This would be a fun place to take kids.

Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and answered the questions that my drunk friend had even though she has been to Midnight Diner hundreds of times. They were nice enough to turn the channel on the TV for us to watch a basketball game. The food could have been a little more flavorful but overall I still enjoyed our visit and I will definitely be going back. I can't remember which day of the week we went but there was no wait. I have passed by before on the weekends and seen a line forming outside during peak hours.

For dinner, the burgers and philly cheese were really good. Highly recommend the waffle fries. Milkshakes were great and it's fun to set at the bar.

She went back to check if they did and promptly came back to tell me that they did. The poached egg was perfectly creamy. I love that.

5gIUBMsH5tAFscQHfL7KMw.text: I came here at 1:20 AM. We had a group of 8. We all ordered like normal. However, it is now 2:12AM and our food was delivered as promised except for mine. I had the corn beef hash plate.   It seemed like there was a commotion going on so our food was delayed, but the service has been terrible since my drink is still empty the entire time I have been waiting for my food.   This is inexcusable service for any restaurant. They have offered to comp my dinner but I cannot let terrible service such as this go. The waitress did not know what I had ordered and we have had no refills on our drinks.  I will never come back to this establishment again. Mark my words.

gaSOJBoV1jkb05dwpjVp6Q.text: I've only been here once and I ordered the shrimp and grits with a strawberry milkshake. Place was clean and the waitress seated me immediately but then seemed to forget about me after I told her it was my first time and I needed more time with the menu. Honestly, it's a larger, commercial style diner so they probably go through a lot of different servers frequently so I would take any service ratings with a grain of salt as it is likely to change month to month. She was friendly though.  Food came out promptly. I've never had shrimp and grits before but it was very flavor and delicious. The milkshake though tasted extremely bland and almost more like butter or cream than actually being sweet. I've had a lot of different milkshakes from different places but I would say that this was definitely the worst milkshake I've ever had, I didn't even finish it, and I always finish my drinks as a matter of principle. It's a shame cause it comes in a glass than a refill tin.   Milkshake aside I would definitely try this place again.  Milkshake aside I say the food was worth trying.

f5ZfMHDAKcICJSOPlAcnyg.text: Odin was a great server.  He had great recommendations for breakfast. We ordered off his recommendation the French toast which was to die for and the pecan waffle with whipped honey butter. Great place and great atmosphere.

-kyIQx4ZaCQXQYbhIZa78g.text: Great diner.  Atmosphere is fun 50s type diner. Service is great. Breakfast was really good at reasonable prices. Had their breakfast special of two pancakes eggs bacon and hash brown.  A lot of good food. Brought home leftover pancakes for the grand kids and they loved them too.

6EX85Jv_cgafl7-d_cZGFQ.text: Very reasonably priced, the Redeye diner caught us off guard. Tucked away in the restaurant/bar scene of the EpiCentre was the chrome and red neon diner. We went twice once for breakfast and the lunch. Excellent biscuits and grits. Very good service and it was clear staff was a well led tight knit group.

ilJkxyKNxVKKXKlz--Omsw.text: Our second time eating here seals the deal as this being a go to place to eat at while you're in Uptown.  Prices are ridiculously good, the selection is diverse enough that everyone should be able to find something they enjoy and the portions are more than generous.  The place is bright and clean and we were greeted by very friendly staff and had a phenomenal waiter that was extremely attentive and professional. I wish I could remember his name.  We ordered a fried shrimp platter, with a side of mash potatoes and a biscuit, philly cheesesteak, pimento burger special with bacon, a kids chicken tenders and fries, and a kids meal burger and fries.  All the food was delicious but the only thing is my daughter didn't like the biscuit that came with her shrimp platter, she said it was very dry.  But hey, drown it in butter and problem solved.  I had the daily special listed on the chalkboard outside and that was the Pimento Cheese and Bacon Burger and it was sooooo sooooo sooooo sooooo good and the fries that came with it took it over the top. I really do hope they put it permanently on their menu because I am hooked. This place is a solid and very reliable place to get some good grub. I'm sold!  That is all!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mr. Square enjoying his lemonade
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ms. Rec Tang waiting for her food!

_cHttD4pAqH-6jisvZD7DQ.text: I went to RedEye Diner for breakfast and was delicious!   Good food, generous portions, cheap and friendly service what else can I ask for?  I had their Steak & eggs with grits - so yummy!   My friend had their special, eggs, choice of meat, grits and a side of french toast. Hers was a very generous portion so if you are hungry definitely try this one.  I heard from regulars (we were sitting at the bar) the shrimp & grits is a must try, I will be back for that  Great find! Definitely recommend! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

l5cxf0yJOy99zI__gve-JQ.text: For our big group of 8, the menu variety at Redeye was perfect for us and everyone found something to suit their tastes. The fried chicken was definitely the highlight -- crispy and golden brown but not at all greasy. As half of our table ordered chicken, our server told us the kitchen was going to make it fresh for us, which we appreciated though it did add to our wait time for food.   The one letdown though was the mac and cheese, which is a favorite for me. Oily, over-cooked noodles with dried cheese clumps is not what I was hoping for when the server said they're "known for our mac and cheese." I'd definitely suggest choosing one of other sides, of which there's plenty more options.

InOgloRevQxzjVd0Q1U9Vg.text: Came here for an early dinner. The shrimp was overcooked but the fish was GOOD!! The mac and cheese was great for diner mac. The biscuit was a random add to go with dish but I enjoyed. The waffle fries with honey mustard was love. Service was good as well. Very helpful and clear. After a great night in the epic centre it would be AMAZING I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Fish combo!!

KIEeoLQ4PNlLuRvIFvgl5w.text: FIRST THINGS FIRST: TRY THEIR CREAMY GRITS! This is 100% honest and not exaggerated: their grits are the best grits I've ever tasted in my life. It is super creamy with a hint of corn and is the perfect texture. Maybe I was just super hungry at the time but I swear they really are THAT GOOD. My dinner date ordered The "Bubba" ($10.99) which came with the grits and I ordered the Redeye Signature Steakburger... honestly we were both going for the grits the entire time because they were that amazing. And it's only a smallish cup that comes on the side of The "Bubba."   Aside from the creamy grits, my dinner date thought that the eggs in The "Bubba" were slightly over cooked and that the biscuits were good but just decent/average. My steakburger was very delicious and cooked to a very nice crisp with very good flavor from their special "secret" sauce. For $7.49 it was a super cheap for how good the burger was.   Overall, the Redeye Diner serves hearty and good food with a very nice atmosphere/vibe that replicates a 60s diner. The service can be slow at times just because it seems busy at all hours of the night since it is in the epicenter. I'm definitely coming back to try more items on their menu specifically the shakes and deserts (I saw lots of people eating only their deserts so it must be good). Again, if you stop by NO MATTER WHAT YOU DO, try their creamy grits (they're $3 bucks as a side order)!

vSNm4CkZ6XDP5cogPHlmyA.text: I went on a Saturday night and I basically ordered the same thing I had gotten from Midnight diner. I was super excited to see they had the coconut flake French toast, but disappointed that I couldn't get a full order (4 pieces) with the meal. I settled for the half order of coconut flakes French toast with turkey sausage patties, over easy eggs and hash browns. I also shared a plate of waffle fries with my friends an trust me- they're nowhere near as good as CFA's waffle fries LOL.  It was a pretty basic meal & the server wasn't as friendly as the woman from Midnight Diner. It's crazy how your service experience can impact a meal because it did. I'd prob go to Midnight Diner before I'll go to Redeye Diner again IMO.

K-OdQ4CspBXMORYZ0InHNw.text: I had a great meal, yet again. It was simple, not fancy and good...just what I like at times. I had two scrambled eggs, Neese's LiverMush, wheat toast and fruit. The food came out in good time and was hot. They serve strong coffee which is what I like. Located in EpiCenter and super easy to find. They are open like 24hrs and serve all kinds of food, there is even a bar area. The tables and dining room were clean.   My only criticism is that a pest control worker can straight through the front door which his pray can and all. I did not appreciate it whatsoever. There has to be a back foot for these types of things and if not, make one.

HrHhx6dbGoWej8Ke2RuerA.text: What! How have I not given the fabulous Mrs. Fab a review! Yes I tend to come in after hours. So of course everything taste delicious! But the thing I love most is how welcoming she is when we come to see her! It's always packed when we come! But all the chatter and plates clinking around us is so intimate. I love the hustle and bustle of people. I always start my visit with a cup of hot coffee and a fresh biscuit. The Philly cheese steak is authentic and the chicken and waffles is so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delicious shrimp appetizer

LhiR1894CTgE1j5hSns3nw.text: I don't know why this place doesn't have 5 stars! My review is based solely on 2 visits...once for breakfast and once for a late night meal. I will say that they crowd was very different from breakfast to late night and the customer service in the morning was a lot better. But, there were sooooo many people trying to get in there for a late night meal compared to breakfast. For breakfast....Please please try the shrimp and grits and also the chicken wings. Nothing more to say....shrimp and grits and wings. Their breakfast was amazing and the servers are super nice.    I was visit for business and staying at the Omni. I was a bit hesitant due to the yelp rating. But when we asked around, this was the recommendation given by multiple people. Definitely worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is just an example of the customer service we received on a weekday for breakfast. Food brought by multiple servers...hot and tasty!

TnQ7krBUK5-nplEGXLqLSQ.text: This place is simply amazing. Amazing wait staff, efficient, and great for your wallet. It's also a nice late night spot; for after you've left the club, bars, etc. I've honestly never been during the regular hours but damn, those late night hours hit different. Let me tell you, this place has amazing grits, eggs, and pancakes. They area also so accommodating to my die (eventhough they charge extra without the waitress specifically letting you know...) I give this place a solid 8 out of ten. As I have been frequenting here for the past three years I have lived here, and they have NEVER failed to disappoint me.

9444DK-VlLgLBhbjYlJuXw.text: No wait and it was during Pride week.  Yay!  It was a cute 50s style diner and you can get anything you want to eat or drink even liquor.   The fried chicken was SO good..crispy...not greasy at all.  We had a bit of a slow waiter but we were in no rush so it was all good.  At one point the staff and patrons starting singing along to the music being played so it was a fun experience overall.  Yes, I would eat there again

yDPZVNDRac6ZDT0joTLzHw.text: My daughter came to town an took me here for my birthday. A very sweet girl Anne Kareen served us and she added to the ambiance of the cute diner!

VEDfBkCeGlVd6hEvZ-6mng.text: Anne was the best server ever! She was so hospitable, conversational, and sweet. The food was delicious, highly recommend the grits, the hashbrowns and chicken tenders. Overall amazing experience

qRSPi3V9BA1B-8RpVIE8Wg.text: Picture it: two starving people who haven't eaten all day and in need of food after attending Smackdown at the arena. Thank god for Redeye Diner.  There's not a lot of options for food late night in uptown, so if you're hungry after a Hornets game, concert, etc this is a great option. They are open 24/7, 365 days a year at the EpiCentre.  It's a huge diner menu and good food at a great price. For this adventure, my boyfriend got The Uptown (waffle, hash browns or grits, and two eggs any style for $9.99). Important note: the hashbrowns here are shredded. Personally, I think those are the best kind. You can also get them smothered, scattered, chunked, or all the way. I got the Cool Ranch Wrap ($8.99 and comes with waffle fries). It all his the spot.   Other menu notes: you can get breakfast anytime. Their signature items are the shrimp & grits, chicken & waffles, and steak burgers.  If you don't have time to sit down and eat, you can also order for pickup by phone or on their website.

IklE_sAR_68wga8pC1wnEA.text: Excellent breakfast. Started with the hostess getting us checked in quickly and keeping us up to the minute on our "wait" (was told 15 min. Probably less than 10 min).  The experience was only made by our server Kris who was the best.  Answered all our questions and was very attentive.   Definitely would come back

7gX6f4dSaq2AQwoob-FPhw.text: Five star Redeye service. Near exquisite food and amazing service from Anne! Will definitely be returning soon with our group of photographers, and perhaps maybe we can even have a photoshoot here sometime. Follow @cltshooters and @zach.visuals on insta.

XlOgEkoExeNJDSzCLW5-tA.text: My first Brunch experience here and it was AMAZING! We had a party of 9. There was a 20 minute wait. Not bad for a Sunday at 11:30. Menu works for all palates. We ordered chicken and waffles, omelettes, French toast and grits. Chicken wings were outstanding and grits were creamy and tasty. To top it off, we had the absolute BEST server- Ron. I highly recommend this place. Great service and food!

Q0eCtfnKASyWlt0PIRrn1w.text: Excellent BUBBA breakfast - biscuit and gravy with cheddar eggs and bacon - WOW what a breakfast.  Service by Jawon was outstanding - very friendly!

ejGx1PLyma7_1TMfrSxRbw.text: Love love love this place! The vibe, the food, the servers, the bouncers, everything. My friends and I love coming here after a night out. It's a place you can always count on. I especially love the creamy grits!

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

YHjQVqpOwAwkkX2VRYA8bg.text: I enjoyed the food. It didn't take long for us to be seated. Our server was great.  We had breakfast. I ordered chicken and waffles and my husband had the 2 egg breakfast. The portions were great and priced reasonably.  I'll visit again when I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States

AFNkVOPI2AsKbVQU9F1Mww.text: So have you ever gone into a place and expected not to like it but been pleasantly surprised? That's what happened to me with this place. I don't know what it was that made me think it wouldn't be good but I was wrong. We started with drinks - mimosa for me (they were out of Blue Moon) and an Angry Orchard for my guy. For lunch, I went with breakfast food (half order of coconut crunchy french toast and hashed browns with mushrooms and onions) and my fella went with lunch (1/4 fried chicken, mac and cheese and mashed potatoes and gravy). Mine was awesome in pretty much every way. I doused the hashed browns with Texas Pete (naturally) and they were perfect! I was a little nervous about the french toast because I don't love coconut but it was delicious! My guy loved his macaroni and cheese, liked his fried chicken (just wished it was better seasoned) and thought the mashed potatoes were just okay ("they kinda taste like mashed potatoes from a fast food place"). He said he would definitely come back again and would try something else (but get the mac and cheese, for sure).  The service was great and fast. Our waitress was super helpful because I had countless questions about items on the menu (shout out to Mercedes!). A win all the way around!

Photo of Redeye Diner - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried chicken with mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese

AXd9xkj2t1POt-SJ73I9kQ.text: Classic American diner. Even have good 50s rock n' roll playing. Came here for breakfast - filling portions. Eggs are moist, bacon cooked to perfection, good coffee, and good marble rye toast. Courteous staff. Located in the center of uptown. Walking distance to all hotels.   Went later for dinner and tried their Nathan's hot dog. Cooked perfectly. Have all the condiments you can choose. Saw the deserts they offer. Variety and all look very good.  Will return when I am in Charlotte.

1F3Tn_SsGT2iRQdMiEXBEQ.text: I was looking for a good breakfast. Came upon Rwdeye on Yelp, and decided to try it. The food was good and the staff very friendly. Planning on visiting again tomorrow before leaving for home.

eovGp3oU5F54hb54mCewFA.text: Great service and food. Clean restaurant and Marq the service was all over it. Im from Texas and will be back to see this place. Keep it up. Don't let Marq go...

-cNgAQUKlEOxT3TfFx7KTw.text: Visiting from the ATL and someone recommended the Redeye Restaurant.  Servers were friendly, but service was lacking and the food was bland.  The feeling of the restaurant is that of a 50's diner with 50's R&B & Rock playing. FYI: waitress didn't know the difference between large wings and whole wings (large wings does not mean whole wings, they are actually whole wings cut up making them large) and the hot flavor is just hot sauce.  Their chicken is ok, but is to bland for my taste.  The just assume the customer knows the menu not taking into account that visitor's come into their place.  When I return to Charlotte I will not go to this restaurant.

dzVd2brnw7VtbsFVCY46tA.text: What a nice experience. Friendly staff, great food, fun atmosphere. I firmly believe any of the negative reviews are coming from intoxicated individuals causing trouble after hours. We went there at 7:00pm on a Friday night and everything was fine. We even complimented the manager and he admitted, the after hours crowd was a lot to deal with. I guess it's a matter of when you go, by the dinner shift was fine.

I0RfuAZcv0P7_lIzwf-zPA.text: Love this diner.  The staff is welcoming every time I come in for a meal.  I always asked for Peter because he goes above and beyond to take care of me.  I always see Peter helping his co-workers and cleans his butt off.  He deserves a good tip that I always deliver.  Thank you Peter for always taking care of me when I come in for a good meal.

9mxjzGlReC6CadU-Om_9JQ.text: Omg...I swear we visited everyday during our vacation. iuTSx4trgO_iLdsUBjaI3Q.text: Walked into this place last night and was amazed to see it was packed, yes they do get very busy but have a bit of patience and stop complaining. I was expecting a wait but we were quickly seated by the hostess. Me and my buddy just wanted some good dessert so I went with the Ultimate Brownie and our waitress Shelby recommended their special Chocolate cake so we got that too. The desserts hit the spot and they were amazing BUT the best part of the experience was our waitress Shelby who was SUPER friendly and made sure we enjoyed our visit...you won't be disappointed if she is serving you (she is so genuine). I was so impressed by her service that I got her name tattooed across my chest :-P.  Thank you Shelby!!  This place has earned a spot in my list and I will definitely return to try their food next time (It did look gooood).

xuco8okl_rdSG8FgwiMDoA.text: The Red Eye Diner is an upscale version of The Midnight Diner located on Carson Boulevard in the South End of Charlotte.  This Diner has the same menu and same great service. The interior decor is similar to a Johnny Rockets meets retro Diner.  We had the signature coconut French toast with bacon, grits. Everything came out hot and tasty. Our waiter was fabulous and extremely attentive. The manager checked on us twice. I did not see one dissatisfied expression in the house this place is wonderful for breakfast lunch and dinner. It is conveniently located in and out door Area mall with great parking.  Once again if you like the Midnight Diner you will love the Red Eye Diner.

yaT40F6wZtxgKJ__EJx2bw.text: This diner had a 30 minute wait to seat people when the restaurant was only filled with 3 tables. The hostess informed me that I could order take out from the counter. The waitress at the counter then informed me after I waited for 10 minutes to be served that I would have to wait 30 minutes to also place a take out order. As I mentioned there were only 3 tables seated in the restaurant and all 3 tables had completed their meals . There were also several other parties still waiting to be seated and all being told the same thing. Two staff members were walking around talking on their cell phones and the others were just chatting to each other . It appeared that no one was working . I then walked around to the pub around the corner which was packed with less staff working . I was seated immediately and served my meal in a timely manner .  I would never recommend this diner and would encourage the management to step up there game and employ staff with a work ethic

ZGHxKnHUA0mMxQ55v0uZ6w.text: It's okay place, food is okay and service was not great. i went Sunday morning, it was busy, but we got seated in 10 mins. It took them 35 mins to get the food to our table, server spilled the drink, didn't even come back to clean it up. Orange juice was warm, didn't even put ice in it, to keep it cold.
